 156+ EF9F ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 157+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,50
 158+ EF9F ~                                    call    LL28_6502   ; Expect 4
 159+ EF9F ~                                    ;break
 160+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,97
 160+ EF9F ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 161+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,76
 162+ EF9F ~                                    call    LL28_6502   ; Expect 1
 163+ EF9F ~                                    ;break
 164+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,$20
 164+ EF9F ~             ld     (Qvar),a
 165+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,$10
 166+ EF9F ~                                    call    LL28_6502   ; Expect 1
 167+ EF9F ~                                    ;break
 168+ EF9F ~                                    ld      d,27
 169+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,76
 170+ EF9F ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD
 171+ EF9F ~                                    ;break
 172+ EF9F ~                                    ld      d,76
 173+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,27
 174+ EF9F ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD
 175+ EF9F ~                                    ;break
 176+ EF9F ~                                    ld      d,200
 177+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,50
 178+ EF9F ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD
 179+ EF9F ~                                    ;break
 180+ EF9F ~                                    ld      d,$20
 181+ EF9F ~                                    ld      a,$10
 182+ EF9F ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD
 183+ EF9F ~                                    ;break
 184+ EF9F ~                                    ret
 185+ EF9F                              ENDIF
 186+ EF9F
 187+ EF9F
 188+ EF9F                              IFDEF DEBUG_LL145_6502
 189+ EF9F ~            Debug_LL145_6502:       ; ld  a,1      : ld  (UbnkLineArrayLen),a
 190+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$0116 : ld  (UbnkLineArray),hl
 191+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$004B : ld  (UbnkLineArray+2),hl
 192+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$00F8 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+4),hl
 193+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$002F : ld  (UbnkLineArray+6),hl
 194+ EF9F ~                                    ; call    DrawLinesLateClipping : ;break
 195+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  a,1      : ld  (UbnkLineArrayLen),a
 196+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$0033 : ld  (UbnkLineArray),hl
 197+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$0016 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+2),hl
 198+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$001D : ld  (UbnkLineArray+4),hl
 199+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$FFBE : ld  (UbnkLineArray+6),hl
 200+ EF9F ~                                    ; call    DrawLinesLateClipping : ;break
 201+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  a,1      : ld  (UbnkLineArrayLen),a
 202+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$0055 : ld  (UbnkLineArray),hl
 203+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$FF83 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+2),hl
 204+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$0033 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+4),hl
 205+ EF9F ~                                    ; ld  hl,$0016 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+6),hl
 206+ EF9F ~                                    ; call    DrawLinesLateClipping :  ;break
 207+ EF9F ~
 208+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  a,1      : ld  (UbnkLineArrayLen),a
 209+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$00B3 : ld  (UbnkLineArray),hl
 210+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$0054 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+2),hl
 211+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$005d : ld  (UbnkLineArray+4),hl
 212+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$ffd5 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+6),hl
 213+ EF9F ~                                    ;call    DrawLinesLateClipping :  ;break
 214+ EF9F ~                                    ;
 215+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  a,1      : ld  (UbnkLineArrayLen),a
 216+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$005d : ld  (UbnkLineArray),hl
 217+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$ffd5 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+2),hl
 218+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$00b9 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+4),hl
 219+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$0028 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+6),hl
 220+ EF9F ~                                    ;call    DrawLinesLateClipping :  ;break
 221+ EF9F ~
 222+ EF9F ~                                    ld  a,1
 222+ EF9F ~              ld  (UbnkLineArrayLen),a
 223+ EF9F ~                                    ld  hl,$ffc7
 223+ EF9F ~              ld  (UbnkLineArray),hl
 224+ EF9F ~                                    ld  hl,$001a
 224+ EF9F ~              ld  (UbnkLineArray+2),hl
 225+ EF9F ~                                    ld  hl,$005d
 225+ EF9F ~              ld  (UbnkLineArray+4),hl
 226+ EF9F ~                                    ld  hl,$ffd5
 226+ EF9F ~              ld  (UbnkLineArray+6),hl
 227+ EF9F ~                                    call    DrawLinesLateClipping
 227+ EF9F ~               ;break
 228+ EF9F ~
 229+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  a,1      : ld  (UbnkLineArrayLen),a
 230+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$0089 : ld  (UbnkLineArray),hl
 231+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$00e2 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+2),hl
 232+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$fff3 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+4),hl
 233+ EF9F ~                                    ;ld  hl,$00b9 : ld  (UbnkLineArray+6),hl
 234+ EF9F ~                                    ;call    DrawLinesLateClipping :  ;break
 235+ EF9F ~
 236+ EF9F ~                                    ret
 237+ EF9F                              ENDIF
 238+ EF9F                      DEFINE DEBUG_6502_LINE_CLIPPING
 239+ EF9F                      IFDEF DEBUG_6502_LINE_CLIPPING
 240+ EF9F
 241+ EF9F 00           xX13        DB 0
 242+ EFA0 00 00        XX1510      DW 0    ; x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 243+ EFA2 00 00        XX1532      DW 0    ; y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 244+ EFA4 00 00        XX1554      DW 0    ; x2
 245+ EFA6              XX1554p1    EQU XX1554+1
 246+ EFA6 00 00        XX1576      DW 0    ; y2
 247+ EFA8              XX1210      EQU XX1576
 248+ EFA8              XX12p1      EQU XX1210+1
 249+ EFA8              XX15X1lo    EQU XX1510
 250+ EFA8              XX15X1hi    EQU XX1510+1
 251+ EFA8              XX15Y1lo    EQU XX1532
 252+ EFA8              XX15Y1hi    EQU XX1532+1
 253+ EFA8              XX15X2lo    EQU XX1554
 254+ EFA8              XX15X2hi    EQU XX1554+1
 255+ EFA8              XX15Y2lo    EQU XX1210
 256+ EFA8              XX15Y2hi    EQU XX1210+1
 257+ EFA8
 258+ EFA8 00           XX12p2      DB 0    ; The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 259+ EFA9 00           XX12p3      DB 0    ; The direction of slope ; + LT to BR; - TR to BL
 260+ EFAA 00           XX12p4      DB 0
 261+ EFAB 00           XX12p5      DB 0
 262+ EFAC              Delta_x     EQU XX12p2
 263+ EFAC              Delta_y     EQU XX12p4
 264+ EFAC 00           Tvar        DB 0    ; The gradient of slope ; 0 if it's a shallow slope (DX > DY) ; &FF if it's a steep slope (DY > DX)
 265+ EFAD                                  ; Returns:  XX15        m         x1 as an 8-bit coordinate XX15+2               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 266+ EFAD 00           Qvar        DB 0
 267+ EFAE 00           Rvar        DB 0    ; general purpose for calcs  Paired with S must be done this way round for SUBHeightFromY1 etc to work
 268+ EFAF 00           Svar        DB 0    ; sign variable
 269+ EFB0              SRvarPair   EQU Rvar
 270+ EFB0 00           Xreg        DB 0
 271+ EFB1 00           Yreg        DB 0
 272+ EFB2              YXregPair   EQU Xreg
 273+ EFB2
 274+ EFB2              ;-- Name: LL28 Calculate R = 256 * A / Q
 275+ EFB2              ;-- LL28+4              Skips the A >= Q check and always returns with C flag cleared, so this can be called if we know the division will work
 276+ EFB2              ;-- LL31                Skips the A >= Q check and does not set the R counter, so this can be used for jumping straight into the division loop if R is already set to 254 and we know the division will work
 277+ EFB2              ;   Reg mapping 6502  Z80
 278+ EFB2              ;               a     a
 279+ EFB2              ;               b     x
 280+ EFB2              ;               c     q
 281+ EFB2              ;               d     r
 282+ EFB2              ;
 283+ EFB2 21 AD EF     LL28_6502:          ld      hl,Qvar                 ; CMP Q                  \ If A >= Q, then the answer will not fit in one byte,
 284+ EFB5 4E                               ld      c,(hl)                  ; using c as Q var
 285+ EFB6 B9                               cp      c
 286+ EFB7                                  FlipCarryFlag
 286+ EFB7 3F          >                        ccf
 287+ EFB8 DA E0 EF                         jp      c, LL2_6502             ; BCS LL2                \ so jump to LL2 to return 255
 288+ EFBB 06 FE                            ld      b,$FE                   ; LDX #%11111110         \ Set R to have bits 1-7 set, so we can rotate through 7 loop iterations, getting a 1 each time, and then we use b as Rvar
 289+ EFBD CB 27        LL31_6502:          sla     a                       ; ASL A                  \ Shift A to the left
 290+ EFBF DA D4 EF                         jp      c,LL29_6502             ; BCS LL29               \ If bit 7 of A was set, then jump straight to the subtraction
 291+ EFC2                                  FlipCarryFlag                   ;                          If A < N, then C flag is set.
 291+ EFC2 3F          >                        ccf
 292+ EFC3                                  JumpIfALTNusng c, LL31_SKIPSUB_6502 ; CMP Q              \ If A < Q, skip the following subtraction
 292+ EFC3 B9          >                        cp      c
 292+ EFC4 DA C9 EF    >                        jp		c, LL31_SKIPSUB_6502
 293+ EFC7                                                                  ; BCC P%+4
 294+ EFC7 91                               sub     c                       ; SBC Q                  \ A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
 295+ EFC8                                  ClearCarryFlag
 295+ EFC8 B7          >                        or a
 296+ EFC9              LL31_SKIPSUB_6502:  FlipCarryFlag
 296+ EFC9 3F          >                        ccf
 297+ EFCA CB 10                            rl      b                       ; ROL R                  \ Rotate the counter in R to the left, and catch the result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 298+ EFCC DA BD EF                         jp      c, LL31_6502            ; BCS LL31               \ If we still have set bits in R, loop back to LL31 to do the next iteration of 7
 299+ EFCF 78                               ld      a,b
 300+ EFD0 32 AE EF                         ld      (Rvar),a
 301+ EFD3 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ R left with remainder of division
 302+ EFD4 91           LL29_6502:          sub     c                       ; SBC Q                  \ A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
 303+ EFD5                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to rotate into the result in R
 303+ EFD5 37          >                        scf
 304+ EFD6 CB 10                            rl      b                       ; ROL R                  \ Rotate the counter in R to the left, and catch the result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 305+ EFD8 DA BD EF                         jp      c, LL31_6502            ; BCS LL31               \ If we still have set bits in R, loop back to LL31 to do the next iteration of 7
 306+ EFDB 78                               ld      a,b                     ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine with R containing the
 307+ EFDC 32 AE EF                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; .
 308+ EFDF C9                               ret                             ; .                      \ remainder of the division
 309+ EFE0 3E FF        LL2_6502:           ld      a,$FF                   ; LDA #255               \ The division is very close to 1, so return the closest
 310+ EFE2 32 AE EF                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; STA R                  \ possible answer to 256, i.e. R = 255
 311+ EFE5                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; we failed so need carry flag set
 311+ EFE5 37          >                        scf
 312+ EFE6 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 313+ EFE7
 314+ EFE7 3A B0 EF     ADDXRegtoY1:        ld      a,(Xreg)                ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 315+ EFEA 4F                               ld      c,a
 316+ EFEB 06 00                            ld      b,0
 317+ EFED 2A A2 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1532)
 318+ EFF0                                  ClearCarryFlag
 318+ EFF0 B7          >                        or a
 319+ EFF1 ED 4A                            adc     hl,bc
 320+ EFF3 22 A2 EF                         ld      (XX1532),hl
 321+ EFF6 C9                               ret
 322+ EFF7
 323+ EFF7 ED 4B B0 EF  ADDYXRegtoY1:       ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 324+ EFFB 2A A2 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1532)
 325+ EFFE                                  ClearCarryFlag
 325+ EFFE B7          >                        or a
 326+ EFFF ED 4A                            adc     hl,bc
 327+ F001 22 A2 EF                         ld      (XX1532),hl
 328+ F004 C9                               ret
 329+ F005
 330+ F005 ED 4B B0 EF  ADDYXRegtoX1:       ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 331+ F009 2A A0 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1510)
 332+ F00C                                  ClearCarryFlag
 332+ F00C B7          >                        or a
 333+ F00D ED 4A                            adc     hl,bc
 334+ F00F 22 A0 EF                         ld      (XX1510),hl
 335+ F012 C9                               ret
 336+ F013
 337+ F013 2A A2 EF     SUBBCFromY1:        ld      hl,(XX1532)             ; Set (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - BC where BC can be say screen height
 338+ F016                                  ClearCarryFlag
 338+ F016 B7          >                        or a
 339+ F017 ED 42                            sbc     hl,bc
 340+ F019 22 AE EF                         ld      (SRvarPair),hl
 341+ F01C C9                               ret
 342+ F01D
 343+ F01D 2A B0 EF     AddSRToYX:          ld      hl,(YXregPair)
 344+ F020 ED 5B AE EF                      ld      de,(SRvarPair)
 345+ F024                                  ClearCarryFlag
 345+ F024 B7          >                        or a
 346+ F025 ED 5A                            adc     hl,de
 347+ F027 22 B0 EF                         ld      (YXregPair),hl
 348+ F02A C9                               ret
 349+ F02B
 350+ F02B
 351+ F02B
 352+ F02B 7C           ClampX:             ld      a,h
 353+ F02C A7                               and     a
 354+ F02D 7D                               ld      a,l
 355+ F02E C8                               ret     z
 356+ F02F F2 34 F0                         jp      p,.Max255
 357+ F032              .Min0:              ZeroA
 357+ F032 AF          >                        xor a
 358+ F033 C9                               ret
 359+ F034 3E FF        .Max255:            ld      a,$FF
 360+ F036 C9                               ret
 361+ F037
 362+ F037 7C           ClampY:             ld      a,h
 363+ F038 A7                               and     a
 364+ F039 CA 44 F0                         jp      z,.ClampYlo
 365+ F03C F2 41 F0                         jp      p,.Max127
 366+ F03F              .Min0:              ZeroA
 366+ F03F AF          >                        xor a
 367+ F040 C9                               ret
 368+ F041 3E 7F        .Max127:            ld      a,127
 369+ F043 C9                               ret
 370+ F044 7D           .ClampYlo:          ld      a,l
 371+ F045 A7                               and     a
 372+ F046 F0                               ret     p
 373+ F047 3E 7F                            ld      a,127
 374+ F049 C9                               ret
 375+ F04A
 376+ F04A              ;-- Rountes to code:
 377+ F04A              ;-- LL118
 378+ F04A              ;-- LL120   Done
 379+ F04A              ;-- LL129   Done
 380+ F04A              ;-- LL123   Done
 381+ F04A                              ; NOTE DOES ABS ONLY
 382+ F04A
 383+ F04A
 384+ F04A                              ;--- LL118 Move along a point until on screen
 385+ F04A              ; In XX1510 x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 386+ F04A              ;    XX1532 y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 387+ F04A              ;    XX12p2 The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 388+ F04A              ;    XX12p3 The direction of slope: * Positive = top left to bottom right * Negative (bit 7 set) = top right to bottom left
 389+ F04A              ;    T      The gradient of slope:* 0 if it's a shallow slope * &FF if it's a steep slope
 390+ F04A              ;  Out  XX150               x1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 391+ F04A              ;       XX152               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 392+ F04A              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 393+ F04A
 394+ F04A
 395+ F04A              ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 396+ F04A              ;--  Calculate the following:
 397+ F04A              ;--   * If T = 0, this is a shallow slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 398+ F04A              ;--   * If T <> 0, this is a steep slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 399+ F04A              ;-- giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 400+ F04A              ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 401+ F04A 3A A0 EF     LL120_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510)              ;LDA XX15               \ Set R = x1_lo
 402+ F04D 32 AE EF                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 403+ F050 CD FC F0                         call    LL129_6502              ;JSR LL129              \ Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2 = line gradient, A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction  (S R) = |S R|
 404+ F053 F5                               push    af                      ;PHA                    \ Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 405+ F054              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    push    af                      ;LDX T                  \ If T is non-zero, then it's a steep slope, so jump
 406+ F054 3A AC EF                         ld      a,(Tvar)                ; .
 407+ F057 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;. REDUNDANT REMOVE IN OPTIMISATION
 408+ F05A A7                               and     a                       ;BNE LL121              \ down to LL121 to calculate this instead (Y X) = (S R) / Q
 409+ F05B              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    pop     af                      ;.                      (recover teh saved A before the cp)
 410+ F05B 20 48                            jr      nz,LL121_6502           ;.
 411+ F05D              ;..   (Y X) = (S R) * Q - must be ABS, sign determined by opposite of the sign of the value on top of stack
 412+ F05D              LL122_6502:         ZeroA                           ;LDA #0                 \ Set A = 0
 412+ F05D AF          >                        xor a
 413+ F05E                          IFDEF DEBUG_LL122_DIRECT
 414+ F05E ~                                DISPLAY "DIRECT CALL TO LL122 so dummy push a to stack with 0"
 415+ F05E ~                                push    af
 416+ F05E                          ENDIF
 417+ F05E 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;TAX                    \ Set (Y X) = 0 so we can start building the answer here
 418+ F061 32 B1 EF                         ld      (Yreg),a                ;TAY
 419+ F064 21 AF EF                         ld      hl,Svar
 420+ F067 ED 4B AE EF                      ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;LSR S                  \ Shift (S R) to the right, so we extract bit 0 of (S R)
 421+ F06B                                  ShiftBCRight1                   ;ROR R                  \ into the C flag
 421+ F06B CB 38       >			   srl b
 421+ F06D CB 19       >			   rr  c
 422+ F06F ED 43 AE EF                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc
 423+ F073 21 AD EF                         ld      hl, Qvar                ;ASL Q                  \ Shift Q to the left, catching bit 7 in the C flag
 424+ F076 CB 26                            sla     (hl)                    ;.
 425+ F078 30 03                            jr      nc, LL126_6502          ;BCC LL126              \ If C (i.e. the next bit from Q) is clear, do not do
 426+ F07A                                                                  ;                         the addition for this bit of Q, and instead skip to LL126 to just do the shifts
 427+ F07A CD 1D F0     LL125_6502:         call    AddSRToYX               ;TXA                    \ Set (Y X) = (Y X) + (S R)  starting with the low bytes And then doing the high bytes
 428+ F07D ED 4B AE EF  LL126_6502:         ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;LSR S                  \ Shift (S R) to the right
 429+ F081                                  ShiftBCRight1                   ;ROR R
 429+ F081 CB 38       >			   srl b
 429+ F083 CB 19       >			   rr  c
 430+ F085 ED 43 AE EF                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc          ;.
 431+ F089 21 AD EF                         ld      hl, Qvar                ;ASL Q                  \ Shift Q to the left, catching bit 7 in the C flag
 432+ F08C CB 26                            sla     (hl)                    ;.
 433+ F08E 38 EA                            jr      c,LL125_6502            ;BCS LL125              \ If C (i.e. the next bit from Q) is set, loop back to LL125 to do the addition for this bit of Q
 434+ F090 20 EB                            jr      nz,LL126_6502           ;BNE LL126              \ If Q has not yet run out of set bits, loop back to LL126 to do the "shift" part of shift-and-add until we have done additions for all the set bits in Q, to give us our multiplication result
 435+ F092 F1                               pop     af                      ;PLA                    \ Restore A, which we calculated above, from the stack
 436+ F093 A7                               and     a                       ;BPL LL133              \ If A is positive jump to LL133 to negate (Y X) and
 437+ F094 F2 ED F0                         jp      p,LL133_6502            ;.
 438+ F097              ;.. return from the subroutine using a tail call
 439+ F097 C9                               ret                             ;RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 440+ F098
 441+ F098              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 442+ F098              ;-- Calculate the following:
 443+ F098              ;--         * If T = 0, this is a shallow slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (does not use X1lo but directly SR)
 444+ F098              ;--         * If T <> 0, this is a steep slope, so calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2  (does not use X1lo but directly SR)
 445+ F098              ;--             giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 446+ F098 CD FC F0     LL123_6502:         call    LL129_6502              ;JSR LL129              \ Call LL129 to do the following   Q = XX12+2   = line gradient
 447+ F09B F5                               push    af                      ;PHA                    \ Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 448+ F09C              ; DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    push    af                      ;LDX T                  \ If T is non-zero, then it's a steep slope, so jump up
 449+ F09C 3A AC EF                         ld      a,(Tvar)                ; .
 450+ F09F 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;BNE LL122              \ to LL122 to calculate this instead:
 451+ F0A2 A7                               and     a                       ;.
 452+ F0A3              ;  DONT NEED PLUS MESSES UP FLAGS                    pop     af                      ;.
 453+ F0A3 20 B8                            jr      nz,LL122_6502           ;.
 454+ F0A5              ;--  The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2
 455+ F0A5 3E FF        LL121_6502:         ld      a,$FF                   ;LDA #%11111111         \ Set Y = %11111111
 456+ F0A7 32 B1 EF                         ld      (Yreg),a                ;TAY
 457+ F0AA CB 27                            sla     a                       ;ASL A                  \ Set X = %11111110
 458+ F0AC 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;TAX
 459+ F0AF              ;--  This sets (Y X) = %1111111111111110, so we can rotate through 15 loop iterations, getting a 1 each time, and then getting a 0 on the 16th iteration... and we can also use it to catch our result bits into bit 0 each time
 460+ F0AF ED 4B AE EF  LL130_6502:         ld      bc,(SRvarPair)          ;ASL R                  \ Shift (S R) to the left
 461+ F0B3                                  ShiftBCLeft1                    ;.
 461+ F0B3 CB 21       >			   sla c
 461+ F0B5 CB 10       >			   rl  b
 462+ F0B7 ED 43 AE EF                      ld      (SRvarPair),bc          ;ROL S
 463+ F0BB 3A AF EF                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ Set A = S
 464+ F0BE 38 07                            jr      c, LL131_6502           ;BCS LL131              \ If bit 7 of S was set, then jump straight to the subtraction
 465+ F0C0 21 AD EF                         ld      hl,Qvar                 ;CMP Q                  \ If A < Q (i.e. S < Q), skip the following subtractions
 466+ F0C3 BE                               cp      (hl)
 467+ F0C4                                  FlipCarryFlag                   ; note flip carry flag here to simulate 6502 operation
 467+ F0C4 3F          >                        ccf
 468+ F0C5 30 12                            jr      nc,LL132A_6502          ;BCC LL132  (NOTE Carry flag reversed in Z80 for CP)
 469+ F0C7              LL131_6502:         FlipCarryFlag                   ;flip carry to make it act like a 6502 borrow
 469+ F0C7 3F          >                        ccf
 470+ F0C8 9E                               sbc     (hl)                    ;SBC Q                  \ A >= Q (i.e. S >= Q) so set:
 471+ F0C9 32 AF EF                         ld      (Svar),a                ;STA S
 472+ F0CC 3A AE EF                         ld      a,(Rvar)                ;LDA R                  \ And then doing the high bytes
 473+ F0CF                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ;\   S = (A R) - Q  = (S R) - Q starting with the low bytes (we know the C flag is set so the subtraction will be correct)
 473+ F0CF B7          >                        or a
 474+ F0D0 DE 00                            sbc     0                       ;SBC #0
 475+ F0D2 32 AE EF                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 476+ F0D5                                  SetCarryFlag                    ;SEC                    \ Set the C flag to rotate into the result in (Y X)
 476+ F0D5 37          >                        scf
 477+ F0D6 C3 DA F0                         jp      LL132_6502              ;added so that we can do a 6502 style carry above
 478+ F0D9 00           LL132A_6502:        nop; FlipCarryFlag
 479+ F0DA ED 4B B0 EF  LL132_6502:         ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; Rotate the counter in (Y X) to the left, and catch the
 480+ F0DE                                  RollBCLeft1                     ; ROL A                  \ result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't
 480+ F0DE CB 11       >               rl  c
 480+ F0E0 CB 10       >               rl  b
 481+ F0E2 ED 43 B0 EF                      ld      (YXregPair),bc          ; TAX                    \ do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
 482+ F0E6 38 C7                            jr      c, LL130_6502           ; BCS LL130              \ If we still have set bits in (Y X), loop back to LL130 to do the next iteration of 15, until we have done the whole division
 483+ F0E8                          IFDEF DEBUG_LL121_DIRECT
 484+ F0E8 ~                                DISPLAY "DIRECT CALL TO LL121 so dummy push"
 485+ F0E8 ~                                push    af
 486+ F0E8                          ENDIF
 487+ F0E8 F1                               pop     af                      ; PLA                    \ Restore A, which we calculated above, from the stack
 488+ F0E9 A7                               and     a                       ; BMI LL128              \ If A is negative jump to LL128 to return from the
 489+ F0EA FA FB F0                         jp      m, LL128_6502           ; .                      \ subroutine with (Y X) as is
 490+ F0ED ED 4B B0 EF  LL133_6502:         ld      bc,(YXregPair)          ; TXA                    \ Otherwise negate (Y X) using two's complement by first
 491+ F0F1                                  macronegate16bc                 ; EOR #%11111111         \ setting the low byte to ~X + 1
 491+ F0F1 AF          >					xor 	a
 491+ F0F2 91          >                    sub 	c
 491+ F0F3 4F          >                    ld 		c,a
 491+ F0F4 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 491+ F0F5 90          >                    sub 	b
 491+ F0F6 47          >                    ld 		b,a
 492+ F0F7 ED 43 B0 EF                      ld      (YXregPair),bc          ; ADC #1                 \ The addition works as we know the C flag is clear from\ when we passed through the BCS above
 493+ F0FB C9           LL128_6502:         ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 494+ F0FC              ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 495+ F0FC              ;..  Do the following, in this order: Q = XX12+2 A = S EOR XX12+3 (S R) = |S R|
 496+ F0FC              ;..  This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 497+ F0FC F5           LL129_6502:         push    af                      ;LDX XX12+2             \ Set Q = XX12+2
 498+ F0FD 3A A8 EF                         ld      a,(XX12p2)              ;.
 499+ F100 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ;.
 500+ F103 32 AD EF                         ld      (Qvar),a                ;STX Q
 501+ F106 F1                               pop     af                      ;.
 502+ F107 3A AF EF                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ If S is positive, jump to LL127
 503+ F10A A7                               and     a                       ;BPL LL127
 504+ F10B F2 23 F1                         jp      p,LL127_6502            ;.
 505+ F10E                                  ZeroA                           ;.LDA #0                \ Otherwise set R = -R
 505+ F10E AF          >                        xor a
 506+ F10F                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ;SEC
 506+ F10F B7          >                        or a
 507+ F110 21 AE EF                         ld      hl, Rvar                ;SBC R
 508+ F113 9E                               sbc     (hl)                    ;.
 509+ F114 32 AE EF                         ld      (Rvar),a                ;STA R
 510+ F117 3A AF EF                         ld      a,(Svar)                ;LDA S                  \ Push S onto the stack
 511+ F11A F5                               push    af                      ;PHA
 512+ F11B EE FF                            xor     $FF                     ;EOR #%11111111         \ Set S = ~S + 1 + C  ?? is this all just doing |Svar|?
 513+ F11D CE 00                            adc     0                       ;ADC #0
 514+ F11F 32 AF EF                         ld      (Svar),a                ;STA S
 515+ F122 F1                               pop     af                      ;PLA                    \ Pull the original, negative S from the stack into A
 516+ F123 21 A9 EF     LL127_6502:         ld      hl,XX12p3               ;EOR XX12+3             \ Set A = original argument S EOR'd with XX12+3
 517+ F126 AE                               xor     (hl)                    ;.
 518+ F127 C9                               ret                             ;RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 519+ F128              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 520+ F128              ;--- LL118 Move along a point until on screen
 521+ F128              ; In XX1510 x1 as a 16-bit coordinate (x1_hi x1_lo)
 522+ F128              ;    XX1532 y1 as a 16-bit coordinate (y1_hi y1_lo)
 523+ F128              ;    XX12p2 The line's gradient * 256 (so 1.0 = 256)
 524+ F128              ;    XX12p3 The direction of slope: * Positive = top left to bottom right * Negative (bit 7 set) = top right to bottom left
 525+ F128              ;    T      The gradient of slope:* 0 if it's a shallow slope * &FF if it's a steep slope
 526+ F128              ;  Out  XX150               x1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 527+ F128              ;       XX152               y1 as an 8-bit coordinate
 528+ F128              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 529+ F128
 530+ F128 3A A1 EF     LL118_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the
 531+ F12B A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL119              \ .
 532+ F12C F2 49 F1                         jp      p, LL119_6502           ;                        \ following
 533+ F12F 32 AF EF     .X1Negative:        ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 534+ F132 CD 4A F0                         call    LL120_6502              ; Call LL120 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 535+ F135                                                                  ;                            (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 536+ F135                                                                  ; with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 537+ F135 CD F7 EF                         call    ADDYXRegtoY1             ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 538+ F138 22 A2 EF                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; .
 539+ F13B 21 00 00                         ld      hl,0                    ; Set x1 = 0
 540+ F13E 22 A0 EF                         ld      (XX1510),hl             ; .
 541+ F141 3E 00                            ld      a,0                     ; set 0 up for replacemetn of the TAX and BEQ bit
 542+ F143 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; TAX                    \ Set X = 0 so the next BEQ becomes a jmp but we will do it anyway in next line
 543+ F146 C3 5F F1                         jp      LL134_6502              ; just do the jump to LL134 rather than setting to equal flag and then jumping
 544+ F149              ;-- Entering LL119 a will always be the value of X1 Hi byte
 545+ F149 CA 5F F1     LL119_6502:         jp      z,LL134_6502            ; BEQ LL134              \ x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen
 546+ F14C                                                                  ;                        \ (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 547+ F14C 32 AF EF                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off
 548+ F14F 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEC S                  \ the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 549+ F150 32 AF EF                         ld      (Svar),a                ;
 550+ F153 CD 4A F0                         call    LL120_6502              ; JSR LL120              \ Call LL120 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 551+ F156                                                                  ;                        \                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 552+ F156                                                                  ;                        \ with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 553+ F156 CD F7 EF                         call    ADDYXRegtoY1             ; TXA                    \ Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 554+ F159 21 FF 00                         ld      hl,255                  ; LDX #255               \ Set x1 = 255
 555+ F15C 22 A0 EF                         ld      (XX1510),hl             ; STX XX15 ;INX; STX XX15+1
 556+ F15F              ;--  We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on  screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for the  y-coordinate
 557+ F15F 3A A3 EF     LL134_6502:         ld      a,(XX1532+1)            ; LDA XX15+3             \ If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip
 558+ F162 A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL135              \ the following
 559+ F163 F2 7B F1                         jp      p, LL135_6502           ; .
 560+ F166 32 AF EF                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 561+ F169 3A A2 EF                         ld      a, (XX1532)             ; LDA XX15+2             \ Set R = y1_lo
 562+ F16C 32 AE EF                         ld      (Rvar),a                ; STA R
 563+ F16F CD 98 F0                         call    LL123_6502              ; JSR LL123              \ Call LL123 to calculate:  (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0 = y1 / gradient
 564+ F172                                                                  ;                        \                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 565+ F172                                                                  ;                         with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 566+ F172 CD 05 F0                         call    ADDYXRegtoX1            ; TXA                    \ Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 567+ F175 21 00 00                         ld      hl,0                    ; LDA #0                 \ Set y1 = 0
 568+ F178 22 A2 EF                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; STA XX15+2, XX15+3
 569+ F17B 01 80 00     LL135_6502:         ld      bc,128                  ; LDA XX15+2             \ Set (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - screen height
 570+ F17E CD 13 F0                         call    SUBBCFromY1             ; .                      \ .
 571+ F181 38 0C                            jr      c, LL136_6502           ; BCC LL136              \ If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < screen height, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136
 572+ F183                                                                  ;                        \ to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 573+ F183              ;;-   If we get here then y1 >= screen height, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 574+ F183 CD 98 F0     LL139_6502:         call    LL123_6502              ; JSR LL123              \ Call LL123 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = (y1 - screen height) / gradient
 575+ F186                                                                  ;                        \                            (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (y1 - screen height) * gradient
 576+ F186                                                                  ;                          with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 577+ F186 CD 05 F0                         call    ADDYXRegtoX1            ; TXA                    \ Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 578+ F189 21 7F 00                         ld      hl, 127                 ; LDA #Y*2-1             \ Set y1 = 2 * #Y - 1. The constant #Y is 96, the y-coordinate of the mid-point of the space view (or in our case 127)
 579+ F18C 22 A2 EF                         ld      (XX1532),hl             ; STA XX15+3             \ pixel row of the space view
 580+ F18F C9           LL136_6502:         ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 581+ F190              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 582+ F190              ;-- LL145 LINE CLIP
 583+ F190              ;-- OPTISIATIONS - VERTICAL HORZONTAL POINT |DX| = |DY| (and all the veriants for +/-)
 584+ F190              ;-- This routine clips the line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) so it fits on-screen, or returns an error if it can't be clipped to fit. The arguments are 16-bit coordinates, and the clipped line is returned using 8-bit screen coordinates.
 585+ F190              ;-- This part sets XX13 to reflect which of the two points are on-screen and off-screen.
 586+ F190              ;-- IN  : XX15(1 0) x1 XX15(3 2) y1 XX15(5 4) x2 XX12(1 0) y2
 587+ F190              ;-- OUT : (X1, Y1), (X2, Y2) Screen coordinate C flag  Clear if the clipped line fits on-screen, set if itdoesn't
 588+ F190              ;         XX13 The state of the original coordinates on-screen:* 0   = (x2, y2) on-screen* 95(64)  = (x1, y1) on-screen,  (x2, y2) off-screen* 191(128) = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) off-screen
 589+ F190              ;              So XX13 is non-zero if the end of the line was clipped,meaning the next line sent to BLINE can't join onto the end but has to start a new segment
 590+ F190              ;         SWAP The swap status of the returned coordinates:* &FF if we swapped the values of (x1, y1) and(x2, y2) as part of the clipping process* 0 if the coordinates are still in the same order
 591+ F190                                  DISPLAY "TODO: treat horz vert and sigle pixel as special cases"
 592+ F190              ; TODO treat horizonal/vert and single pixel as special cases
 593+ F190              LL145_6502:         ZeroA                           ; LDA #0                 \ Set SWAP = 0
 593+ F190 AF          >                        xor a
 594+ F191 32 83 CA                         ld      (SWAP),a                ; STA SWAP
 595+ F194 3A A5 EF                         ld      a,(XX1554+1)            ; LDA XX15+5             \ Set A = x2_hi (use b as a substibute for a)
 596+ F197 47                               ld      b,a                     ; .
 597+ F198              ; Note that as we are interested in the sign of XX113 then this needs to be >= 128 or < 128 or 0, we will use 191 as per bbc for now
 598+ F198              ; for the screen coord we will use 127 though, we use c as a temporay X register
 599+ F198 3E BF        LL147_6502:         ld      a,191                   ; LDX #Y*2-1             \ Set X = #Y * 2 - 1. The constant #Y is 96, the y-coordinate of the mid-point of the space view, so this sets Y2 to 191, the y-coordinate of the bottom pixel row of the space view
 600+ F19A 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; .
 601+ F19D              ;                    ld      a,127
 602+ F19D              ;                    ld      c,a
 603+ F19D 78           .CheckX2Y2High:     ld      a,b                     ; ORA XX12+1             \ If one or both of x2_hi and y2_hi are non-zero, jump
 604+ F19E 21 A7 EF                         ld      hl,XX12p1               ; .
 605+ F1A1 B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 606+ F1A2 C2 B2 F1                         jp      nz,LL107_6502           ; BNE LL107              \ to LL107 to skip the following, leaving X at 191
 607+ F1A5 3E 7F        .CheckY2Lo:         ld      a,127 ;,c               ; get back the temporary x reg from c
 608+ F1A7 21 A6 EF                         ld      hl,XX1210               ; CPX XX12               \ If y2_lo > the y-coordinate of the bottom of screen (a is being used as X at this point still)
 609+ F1AA BE                               cp      (hl)                    ; .
 610+ F1AB DA B2 F1                         jp      c,LL107_6502            ; BCC LL107              \ then (x2, y2) is off the bottom of the screen, so skip the following instruction, leaving X at 127
 611+ F1AE                                  ZeroA                           ; LDX #0                 \ Set X = 0
 611+ F1AE AF          >                        xor a
 612+ F1AF 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a
 613+ F1B2 3A B0 EF     LL107_6502:         ld      a,(Xreg)                ; STX XX13               \ Set XX13 = X, so we have * XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen* XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lois off the bottom of the screen
 614+ F1B5 32 6E 7F                         ld      (XX13),a                ; now c is released as a temporary x reg
 615+ F1B8 3A A1 EF                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If one or both of x1_hi and y1_hi are non-zero, jump
 616+ F1BB 21 A3 EF                         ld      hl,XX1532+1             ; ORA XX15+3             \ to LL83
 617+ F1BE B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 618+ F1BF C2 FF F1                         jp      nz,LL83_6502            ; BNE LL83
 619+ F1C2              ; DEBUG SIMPLIFIED CODE, now we just compare y1 lo > 127
 620+ F1C2 3A A2 EF                         ld      a,(XX1532)              ; If y1_lo > the y-coordinate of the bottom of screen (If A >= N, then C flag is reset.) ;ld      a,127                   ; LDA #Y*2-1             \ If y1_lo > the y-coordinate of the bottom of screen (If A >= N, then C flag is reset.)
 621+ F1C5 26 7F                            ld      h,127                   ; then (x1, y1) is off the bottom of the screen, so jump                                 ;ld      hl,XX1532               ; CMP XX15+2             \ then (x1, y1) is off the bottom of the screen, so jump
 622+ F1C7 BC                               cp      h                       ; to LL83                                                                                ;cp      (hl)                    ; .                      \ to LL83
 623+ F1C8 D2 FF F1                         jp      nc, LL83_6502         ; BCC LL83               \ . (y1 > 127 jump, i.e. 127 <= y1 )
 624+ F1CB 3A 6E 7F                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen. If XX13 is non-zero, i.e. (x2, y2) is off-screen, jump
 625+ F1CE A7                               and     a                       ; BNE LL108              \ to LL108 to halve it before continuing at LL83
 626+ F1CF C2 FA F1                         jp      nz,LL108_6502
 627+ F1D2              ; If we get here, the high bytes are all zero, which means the x-coordinates are < 256 and therefore fit on screen, and neither coordinate is off the bottom of the screen. That means both coordinates are already on
 628+ F1D2              ; screen, so we don't need to do any clipping, all weneed to do is move the low bytes into (X1, Y1) and X2, Y2) and return
 629+ F1D2              ; X1 = XX15 (10)  Y1 = XX15+1 X2 = XX15+2 Y2 = XX15+3
 630+ F1D2                  DEFINE CLAMPINGEXTREMES
 631+ F1D2              LL146_6502: IFDEF CLAMPINGEXTREMES
 632+ F1D2 2A A0 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1510)             ;  Save X1 to XX1510
 633+ F1D5 CD 2B F0                         call    ClampX
 634+ F1D8 32 A0 EF                         ld      (XX1510),a
 635+ F1DB                          ENDIF
 636+ F1DB 2A A2 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1532)             ;  hl = y1
 637+ F1DE CD 37 F0                         call    ClampY
 638+ F1E1 32 A1 EF                         ld      (XX1510+1),a            ;  XX1510... = [X1][Y1]
 639+ F1E4
 640+ F1E4 2A A4 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1554)             ;  de = x2
 641+ F1E7 CD 2B F0                         call    ClampX
 642+ F1EA 32 A2 EF                         ld      (XX1510+2),a            ;  XX1510... = [X1][Y1][X2]
 643+ F1ED
 644+ F1ED 2A A6 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1576)             ;  bc = y2
 645+ F1F0 CD 37 F0                         call    ClampY
 646+ F1F3 32 A3 EF                         ld      (XX1510+3),a            ;  XX1510... = [X1][Y1][X2][Y2]
 647+ F1F6
 648+ F1F6                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; CLC                    \ Clear the C flag as the clipped line fits on-screen
 648+ F1F6 B7          >                        or a
 649+ F1F7 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 650+ F1F8              LL109_6502:         SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to indicate the clipped line does not fit on-screen
 650+ F1F8 37          >                        scf
 651+ F1F9 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 652+ F1FA 21 6E 7F     LL108_6502:         ld      hl,XX13                 ; LSR XX13               \ If we get here then (x2, y2) is off-screen and XX13 is
 653+ F1FD CB 3E                            srl     (hl)                    ;                        \ 191, (128)  so shift XX13 right to halve it to 95 (64)
 654+ F1FF              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 655+ F1FF              ;-- LL145 (Part 2 of 4)
 656+ F1FF 3A 6E 7F     LL83_6502:          ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 < 128 then only one of the points is on-screen
 657+ F202 A7                               and     a                       ; BPL LL115              \ so jump down to LL115 to skip the checks of whether
 658+ F203 F2 4F F2                         jp      p,LL115_6502            ;                        \ both points are in the strips to the right or bottom of the screen
 659+ F206              ;-- If we get here, both points are off-screen
 660+ F206 3A A1 EF                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109
 661+ F209 21 A5 EF                         ld      hl,XX1554+1             ; AND XX15+5             \ to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as
 662+ F20C A6                               and     (hl)
 663+ F20D FA F8 F1                         jp      m, LL109_6502           ; BMI LL109              \ the entire line is above the top of the screen
 664+ F210 3A A3 EF                         ld      a,(XX1532+1)            ; LDA XX15+3             \ If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109
 665+ F213 21 A7 EF                         ld      hl,XX1576+1             ; AND XX12+1             \ to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as
 666+ F216 A6                               and     (hl)                    ; BMI LL109              \ the entire line is to the left of the screen
 667+ F217 FA F8 F1                         jp      m,LL109_6502            ; .
 668+ F21A 3A A1 EF                         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDX XX15+1             \ Set A = X = x1_hi - 1
 669+ F21D 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEX
 670+ F21E 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; TXA
 671+ F221 F5                               push    af                      ; LDX XX15+5     SP+1    \ Set XX12+2 = x2_hi - 1, we need to save a register first
 672+ F222 3A A5 EF                         ld      a,(XX1554+1)            ; .
 673+ F225 3D                               dec     a                       ; DEX
 674+ F226 32 B0 EF                         ld      (Xreg),a                ; STX XX12+2
 675+ F229 F1                               pop     af                      ; .              SP+0    restore a register
 676+ F22A 21 A7 EF                         ld      hl,XX1576+1             ; ORA XX12+2             \ If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set,
 677+ F22D B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 678+ F22E F2 F8 F1                         jp      p, LL109_6502           ; BPL LL109              \ jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 679+ F231              ; for this bit, while z80 uses carry the opposite way to 6502, 6502 uses borrow, in effect inverting the flip
 680+ F231              ;NOTEFOUND A PATH WHERE IT DOES NOT DO THIS CHECK e.g. 90 B2 8D A2
 681+ F231 3A A2 EF     LL83_DEBUG:         ld      a,(XX1532)              ; LDA XX15+2             \ If y1_lo < y-coordinate of screen bottom, clear the C
 682+ F234 FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ flag, otherwise set it (NOTE FLIPPED IN z80)
 683+ F236 3A A3 EF                         ld      a,(XX1532+1)            ; LDA XX15+3             \ Set XX12+2 = y1_hi - (1 - C), so:
 684+ F239              ;                    FlipCarryFlag                   ; as 6502 uses borrow in subtracts we flip for SBC as z80 CP does opposite too, if A < N carry set so flip
 685+ F239 DE 00                            sbc     0                       ; SBC #0                 \ .
 686+ F23B 32 A8 EF                         ld      (XX12p2),a              ; STA XX12+2             \  * Set XX12+2 = y1_hi - 1 if y1_lo is on-screen * Set XX12+2 = y1_hi  otherwise We do this subtraction because we are only interested
 687+ F23E 3A A6 EF                         ld      a,(XX1576)              ; LDA XX12               \ If y2_lo < y-coordinate of screen bottom, clear the C
 688+ F241 FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ flag, otherwise set it
 689+ F243 3A A7 EF                         ld      a,(XX1576+1)            ; LDA XX12+1             \ Set XX12+2 = y2_hi - (1 - C), so:
 690+ F246              ;                    FlipCarryFlag
 691+ F246 DE 00                            sbc     0                       ; SBC #0                   * Set XX12+1 = y2_hi - 1 if y2_lo is on-screen  * Set XX12+1 = y2_hi     otherwise
 692+ F248 21 A8 EF                         ld      hl,XX12p2               ; ORA XX12+2             \ If neither XX12+1 or XX12+2 have bit 7 set, jump to
 693+ F24B B6                               or      (hl)                    ; .
 694+ F24C F2 F8 F1                         jp      p,LL109_6502            ; BPL LL109              \ LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 695+ F24F              ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 696+ F24F              ;-- LL145 (Part 3 of 4) Summary: Clip line: Calculate the line's gradient
 697+ F24F 3A B1 EF     LL115_6502:         ld      a,(Yreg)                ; TYA                    \ Store Y on the stack so we can preserve it through the call to this routine
 698+ F252 F5                               push    af                      ; PHA            SP+1    \ call to this subroutine
 699+ F253 2A A4 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1554)             ; LDA XX15+4             \ Set XX12+2 = x2_lo - x1_lo
 700+ F256 ED 5B A0 EF                      ld      de,(XX1510)             ; LDA XX15+5             \ Set XX12+3 = x2_hi - x1_hi
 701+ F25A                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; SBC XX15+1
 701+ F25A B7          >                        or a
 702+ F25B ED 52                            sbc     hl,de                   ; .
 703+ F25D 22 FE F5                         ld      (delta_x),hl            ; .
 704+ F260 2A A6 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1576)             ; LDA XX12               \ Set XX12+4 = y2_lo - y1_lo
 705+ F263 ED 5B A2 EF                      ld      de,(XX1532)             ;
 706+ F267                                  ClearCarryFlag                  ; SBC XX15+2
 706+ F267 B7          >                        or a
 707+ F268 ED 52                            sbc     hl,de                   ; .
 708+ F26A 22 00 F6                         ld      (delta_y),hl            ; .
 709+ F26D              ; So we now have:  delta_x in XX12(3 2)  delta_y in XX12(5 4) where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 710+ F26D 3A 01 F6                         ld      a,(delta_y+1)           ; EOR XX12+3             \ Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so
 711+ F270 21 FF F5                         ld      hl,delta_x+1
 712+ F273 AE                               xor     (hl)
 713+ F274 32 AF EF                         ld      (Svar),a                ; STA S                  \ if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs (perhaps we should do bit 7 mask ?????????
 714+ F277 2A 00 F6                         ld      hl,(delta_y)            ; LDA XX12+5             \ If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip
 715+ F27A 7C                               ld      a,h
 716+ F27B A7                               and     a
 717+ F27C F2 88 F2                         jp      p, LL110_6502           ; BPL LL110              \ the following
 718+ F27F                                  NegHL                           ; LDA #0                 \ Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it
 718+ F27F AF          >                    xor a
 718+ F280 95          >                    sub l
 718+ F281 6F          >                    ld l,a
 718+ F282 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 718+ F283 94          >                    sub h
 718+ F284 67          >                    ld h,a
 719+ F285 22 00 F6                         ld      (delta_y),hl            ; positive, starting with the low bytes
 720+ F288 2A FE F5     LL110_6502:         ld      hl,(delta_x)            ; LDA XX12+3             \ If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL111 to skip
 721+ F28B 7C                               ld      a,h                     ; BPL LL111              \ the following
 722+ F28C A7                               and     a                       ; .
 723+ F28D F2 99 F2                         jp      p,LL111_6502            ; .
 724+ F290                                  NegHL                           ; SEC                    \ Otherwise flip the sign of delta_x to make it
 724+ F290 AF          >                    xor a
 724+ F291 95          >                    sub l
 724+ F292 6F          >                    ld l,a
 724+ F293 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 724+ F294 94          >                    sub h
 724+ F295 67          >                    ld h,a
 725+ F296 22 FE F5                         ld      (delta_x),hl            ; LDA #0                 \ positive, starting with the low bytes
 726+ F299              ;--  We now keep halving |delta_x| and |delta_y| until both of them have zero in their high bytes
 727+ F299 2A FE F5     LL111_6502:         ld      hl,(delta_x)
 728+ F29C ED 5B 00 F6                      ld      de,(delta_y)
 729+ F2A0 7C                               ld      a,h                     ; TAX                    \ If |delta_x_hi| is non-zero, skip the following
 730+ F2A1 B2                               or      d                       ; BNE LL112
 731+ F2A2 CA B7 F2                         jp      z,LL113_6502            ; LDX XX12+5             \ If |delta_y_hi| = 0, jump down to LL113 (as both |delta_x_hi| and |delta_y_hi| are 0)
 732+ F2A5              LL112_6502:         ShiftHLRight1                   ; LSR A                  \ Halve the value of delta_x in (A XX12+2)
 732+ F2A5 CB 3C       >			   srl h
 732+ F2A7 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 733+ F2A9                                  ShiftDERight1                   ; LSR XX12+5             \ Halve the value of delta_y XX12(5 4)
 733+ F2A9 CB 3A       >			   srl d
 733+ F2AB CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 734+ F2AD 22 FE F5                         ld      (delta_x),hl
 735+ F2B0 ED 53 00 F6                      ld      (delta_y),de            ; write them back so we don't end up in an infinite loop
 736+ F2B4 C3 99 F2                         jp  LL111_6502                  ; JMP LL111              \ Loop back to LL111
 737+ F2B7              ;-- By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero
 738+ F2B7              LL113_6502:         ZeroA                           ; STX T                  \ We know that X = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ  above, so this sets T = 0
 738+ F2B7 AF          >                        xor a
 739+ F2B8 32 AC EF                         ld  (Tvar),a
 740+ F2BB 3A FE F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; LDA XX12+2             \ If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more
 741+ F2BE 21 00 F6                         ld      hl,delta_y              ; CMP XX12+4             \ vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 742+ F2C1 BE                               cp      (hl)
 743+ F2C2 DA D4 F2                         jp      c, LL114_6502           ; BCC LL114              ; if delta y > delta x then its a steep slope so we do 256*dy/dx
 744+ F2C5              ;-- If we get here then our line is more horizontal than vertical, so it is a shallow slope
 745+ F2C5 3A FE F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; STA Q                  \ Set Q = delta_x_lo
 746+ F2C8 32 AD EF                         ld      (Qvar),a                ; .
 747+ F2CB 3A 00 F6                         ld      a,(delta_y)             ; LDA XX12+4             \ Set A = delta_y_lo
 748+ F2CE CD B2 EF                         call    LL28_6502               ; JSR LL28               \ Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 749+ F2D1 C3 E5 F2                         jp      LL116_6502              ; JMP LL116              \ Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 750+ F2D4              ;-- If we get here then our line is more vertical than horizontal, so it is a steep slope
 751+ F2D4 3A 00 F6     LL114_6502:         ld      a,(delta_y)             ; LDA XX12+4             \ Set Q = delta_y_lo
 752+ F2D7 32 AD EF                         ld      (Qvar),a                ; STA Q
 753+ F2DA 3A FE F5                         ld      a,(delta_x)             ; LDA XX12+2             \ Set A = delta_x_lo
 754+ F2DD CD B2 EF                         call    LL28_6502               ; JSR LL28               \ Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 755+ F2E0 3E FF                            ld      a,$FF                   ; DEC T                  \ T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF when our
 756+ F2E2 32 AC EF                         ld      (Tvar),a                ;                        \ line is steep
 757+ F2E5              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 758+ F2E5              ;--- LL116 This part sets things up to call the routine in LL188, which does the actual clipping.
 759+ F2E5              ;--  If we get here, then R has been set to the gradient of the line (x1, y1) to(x2, y2), with T indicating the gradient of slope: * 0   = shallow slope (more horizontal than vertical)
 760+ F2E5              ;--                                                                                                                                * &FF = steep slope (more vertical than horizontal)
 761+ F2E5              ;-- XX13 has been set as follows: * 0   = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) on-screen * 95(64)  = (x1, y1) on-screen,  (x2, y2) off-screen * 191(128) = (x1, y1) off-screen, (x2, y2) off-screen
 762+ F2E5 3A AE EF     LL116_6502:         ld      a,(Rvar)                ; LDA R                  \ Store the gradient in XX12+2
 763+ F2E8 32 A8 EF                         ld      (XX12p2),a              ; STA XX12+2
 764+ F2EB 3A AF EF                         ld      a,(Svar)                ; LDA S                  \ Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means
 765+ F2EE 32 A9 EF                         ld      (XX12p3),a              ; STA XX12+3             \ top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left
 766+ F2F1 3A 6E 7F                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 767+ F2F4 FE 00                            cp      0                       ; BEQ LL138
 768+ F2F6 CA FC F2                         jp      z,LL138_6502            ; .
 769+ F2F9 F2 18 F3                         jp      p, LLX117_6502          ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95 (64) as 128 would be negative). This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump
 770+ F2FC              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 771+ F2FC CD 28 F1     LL138_6502:         call    LL118_6502              ; JSR LL118              \ Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 772+ F2FF 3A 6E 7F                         ld      a,(XX13)                ; LDA XX13               \ If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to
 773+ F302 A7                               and     a
 774+ F303 F2 3B F3                         jp      p,LL124_6502            ; BPL LL124              \ LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 775+ F306              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 191 (128) (both coordinates areoff-screen)
 776+ F306 3A A1 EF     LL117_6502:         ld      a,(XX1510+1)            ; LDA XX15+1             \ If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 777+ F309 21 A3 EF                         ld      hl,XX1532+1             ; ORA XX15+3             \ LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 778+ F30C B6                               or      (hl)
 779+ F30D C2 43 F3                         jp      nz, LL137_6502          ; BNE LL137              \ set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 780+ F310 3A A2 EF                         ld      a,(XX1532)              ; LDA XX15+2             \ If y1_lo > y-coordinate of the bottom of the screen
 781+ F313 FE 80                            cp      128                     ; CMP #Y*2               \ jump to LL137 to return from the subroutine with the
 782+ F315 D2 43 F3                         jp      nc, LL137_6502          ; BCS LL137              \ C flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 783+ F318              ;-- If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 784+ F318 2A A0 EF     LLX117_6502:        ld      hl,(XX1510)             ; LDX XX15               \ Swap x1_lo = x2_lo
 785+ F31B ED 5B A4 EF                      ld      de,(XX1554)
 786+ F31F ED 53 A0 EF                      ld      (XX1510),de
 787+ F323 22 A4 EF                         ld      (XX1554),hl
 788+ F326 2A A2 EF                         ld      hl,(XX1532)             ; LDX XX15+2             \ Swap y1_lo = y2_lo
 789+ F329 ED 5B A6 EF                      ld      de,(XX1576)
 790+ F32D ED 53 A2 EF                      ld      (XX1532),de
 791+ F331 22 A6 EF                         ld      (XX1576),hl
 792+ F334 CD 28 F1                         call    LL118_6502              ; JSR LL118              \ Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 793+ F337 21 83 CA                         ld      hl,SWAP
 794+ F33A 35                               dec     (hl)                    ; DEC SWAP               \ Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 795+ F33B F1           LL124_6502:         pop     af                      ; PLA            SP+0    \ Restore Y from the stack so it gets preserved through
 796+ F33C 32 B1 EF                         ld      (Yreg),a                ; TAY                    \ the call to this subroutine
 797+ F33F CD D2 F1                         call    LL146_6502              ; JMP LL146              \ Jump up to LL146 to move the low bytes of (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) into (X1, Y1) and (X2, Y2), and return from the subroutine with a successfully clipped line
 798+ F342 C9                               ret                             ; then exit so we don't pop it twice
 799+ F343 F1           LL137_6502:         pop     af                      ; PLA            SP+0    \ Restore Y from the stack so it gets preserved through
 800+ F344 32 B1 EF                         ld      (Yreg),a                ; TAY                    \ the call to this subroutine
 801+ F347                                  SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to indicate the clipped line does not fit on-screen
 801+ F347 37          >                        scf
 802+ F348 C9                               ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 803+ F349                      ENDIF
# file closed: ./Layer2Graphics/BBCEliteDirectMappingLL118.asm
 798  F349                  INCLUDE "./Layer2Graphics/l2_draw_any_line.asm"
# file opened: ./Layer2Graphics/l2_draw_any_line.asm
   1+ F349
   2+ F349 FF FF        starty                  DW     $FFFF
   3+ F34B FF FF        endy                    DW     $FFFF
   4+ F34D CF           traingleColor           DB     $CF
   5+ F34E 00 00 00...  SaveArrayS1             DS     128*2
   6+ F44E 00 00 00...  SaveArrayS2             DS     128*2
   7+ F54E
   8+ F54E                      IFDEF Add_l2_drawHorzClipY
   9+ F54E ~            l2_drawHorzClipY:
  10+ F54E ~            .ClipY:                 ex      de,hl                       ; get X1 into de
  11+ F54E ~            .ClipDE:                bit     7,d
  12+ F54E ~                                    jr      z,.DEPositive
  13+ F54E ~            .DENegative:            ld      de,0
  14+ F54E ~                                    jp      .ClipDEDone
  15+ F54E ~            .DEPositive:            ld      a,d
  16+ F54E ~                                    and     a
  17+ F54E ~                                    jp      z,.ClipDE127
  18+ F54E ~            .ClipDE256:             ld      de,127
  19+ F54E ~                                    jp      .ClipDEDone
  20+ F54E ~            .ClipDE127:             bit     7,e
  21+ F54E ~                                    jp      z,.ClipDEDone
  22+ F54E ~                                    ld      de,127
  23+ F54E ~            .ClipDEDone:
  24+ F54E ~            .AdjustStartY:          ld      hl,(starty)
  25+ F54E ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn           ; if de < HL
  26+ F54E ~                                    jr      z,.AdjustEndY               ;
  27+ F54E ~                                    jr      c,.AdjustEndY               ;
  28+ F54E ~            .ClipStartY:            ld      (starty),de                 ; .
  29+ F54E ~            .AdjustEndY:            ld      hl,(endy)                   ; is endy still uninitialised
  30+ F54E ~            .InitEndY:              ld      a,h                         ;
  31+ F54E ~                                    and     l                           ;
  32+ F54E ~                                    cp      $FF                         ;
  33+ F54E ~                                    jr      z,.ForceEndYSet
  34+ F54E ~            .CheckEndY:             call    CompareHLDESgn           ; if de < HL
  35+ F54E ~                                    ret     z
  36+ F54E ~                                    ret     nc
  37+ F54E ~            .ForceEndYSet:          ld      (endy),de
  38+ F54E ~                                    ret
  39+ F54E                      ENDIF
  40+ F54E
  41+ F54E
  42+ F54E 2A D6 F5     l2_drawVertClip:        ld      hl,(y1)
  43+ F551 ED 5B DA F5                          ld      de,(y2)
  44+ F555 CD AA 99                             call    CompareHLDESgn
  45+ F558 30 01                                jr      nc,.y1ltey2
  46+ F55A EB                                   ex      de,hl
  47+ F55B CB 7C        .y1ltey2:               bit     7,h
  48+ F55D CA 63 F5                             jp      z,.y1Positive
  49+ F560 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0
  50+ F563 7A           .y1Positive             ld      a,d
  51+ F564 A7                                   and     a
  52+ F565 CA 6D F5                             jp      z,.y2lt255
  53+ F568 1E 7F                                ld      e,127
  54+ F56A C3 74 F5                             jp      .y2Clipped
  55+ F56D CB 7B        .y2lt255:               bit     7,e
  56+ F56F CA 74 F5                             jp      z,.y2Clipped
  57+ F572 1E 7F                                ld      e,127
  58+ F574 ED 4B D4 F5  .y2Clipped:             ld      bc,(x1)
  59+ F578 45                                   ld      b,l
  60+ F579 53                                   ld      d,e
  61+ F57A 1E BF                                ld      e,$BF
  62+ F57C C3 55 E5                             jp      l2_draw_vert_line_to                ; ">bc = row col d = to position, e = color"
  63+ F57F
  64+ F57F
  65+ F57F 2A D4 F5     l2_drawHorzClip:        ld      hl,(x1)
  66+ F582 ED 5B D8 F5                          ld      de,(x2)
  67+ F586 CD AA 99                             call    CompareHLDESgn
  68+ F589 30 01                                jr      nc,.x1ltex2
  69+ F58B EB                                   ex      de,hl
  70+ F58C CB 7C        .x1ltex2:               bit     7,h
  71+ F58E CA 94 F5                             jp      z,.x1Positive
  72+ F591 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0
  73+ F594 7A           .x1Positive             ld      a,d
  74+ F595 A7                                   and     a
  75+ F596 CA 9B F5                             jp      z,.x2Clipped
  76+ F599 1E FF                                ld      e,255
  77+ F59B ED 4B D6 F5  .x2Clipped:             ld      bc,(y1)
  78+ F59F 41                                   ld      b,c
  79+ F5A0 4D                                   ld      c,l
  80+ F5A1 53                                   ld      d,e
  81+ F5A2 1E BF                                ld      e,$BF
  82+ F5A4 C3 BD E4                             jp      l2_draw_horz_line_to                ; "bc = left side row,col, d right pixel, e = color"
  83+ F5A7
  84+ F5A7                      IFDEF Add_l2_drawVertClipY
  85+ F5A7 ~            l2_drawVertClipY:       bit     7,d                     ; i = (py1<0?0:py1);
  86+ F5A7 ~                                    jr      z,.PYIsOK
  87+ F5A7 ~            .SetPYTo0:              ld      de,0
  88+ F5A7 ~            .PYIsOK:                ld      hl,(starty)
  89+ F5A7 ~                                    IsHLEqu255
  90+ F5A7 ~                                    jp      z,.UpdateStartY
  91+ F5A7 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn       ; or starty > py
  92+ F5A7 ~                                    jr      nc,.UpdateStartY        ;
  93+ F5A7 ~                                    jp      .PrepareUpdateArray
  94+ F5A7 ~            .UpdateStartY:          ld      (starty),de
  95+ F5A7 ~            .PrepareUpdateArray:    JumpIfRegLTE c, 127, .UpdateCounters ; we loop from
  96+ F5A7 ~                                    ld      c,127
  97+ F5A7 ~            .UpdateEndY:            ld      (endy),bc               ; save BC to endy y as its now clamped, thsi frees up BC regsiters
  98+ F5A7 ~            .UpdateCounters:        ld      hl,ix                   ; get target array index and set it to
  99+ F5A7 ~                                    add     hl,de                   ; targetArray[de]
 100+ F5A7 ~                                    add     hl,de                   ; .
 101+ F5A7 ~                                    ld      a,c                     ; now set up B as an iterator
 102+ F5A7 ~                                    sub     b                       ; for py2 - py1 + 1 entries
 103+ F5A7 ~                                    inc     a                       ; .
 104+ F5A7 ~                                    ld      b,a                     ; .
 105+ F5A7 ~                                    ld      de,ix                   ; we don't need de anymore to move ix for faster instructions
 106+ F5A7 ~            .UpdateArray:           ld      (hl),de                 ; use sjasm fake as it does (hl)=e,inc hl, (hl)=d,inc hl
 107+ F5A7 ~                                    inc     a                       ; use a as a counter for the end when we update EndY
 108+ F5A7 ~                                    djnz    .UpdateArray            ; .
 109+ F5A7 ~                                    ret                             ; we are now done
 110+ F5A7                      ENDIF
 111+ F5A7
 112+ F5A7
 113+ F5A7              ; ">l2_draw_any_line, bc = y0,x0 de=y1,x1,a=color: determines if its horizontal, vertical or diagonal then hands off the work"
 114+ F5A7              ; b - y0 c - x0, d - y1 e - x1 a - colour
 115+ F5A7 08           l2_draw_any_line:       ex		af,af'              ; save colour into a'
 116+ F5A8 79                                   ld		a,c                 ; if x and e are the same its horizontal
 117+ F5A9 BB                                   cp		e
 118+ F5AA 28 08                                jr		z,.HorizontalLineCheck
 119+ F5AC 78                                   ld		a,b                 ; if b and d are the same its vertica;
 120+ F5AD BA                                   cp		d
