 160++CB8C 35                                   dec     (hl)
 161++CB8D D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 162++CB8E E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 163++CB8F 3A 60 7F                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 164++CB92 32 7F CA                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 165++CB95 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 166++CB97 3A 61 7F                             ld      a,(varS)
 167++CB9A 32 80 CA                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 168++CB9D                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 169++CB9D FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 170++CB9F FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 171++CBA1 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 172++CBA3 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 173++CBA6 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 174++CBA8              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 175++CBA8 CD CF CB     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 176++CBAB FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 177++CBAD ED 27 80                             test    $80
 178++CBB0 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 179++CBB2              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 180++CBB2 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 181++CBB3 B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 182++CBB4 C2 D5 CA                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 183++CBB7 B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 184++CBB8 FA D5 CA                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 185++CBBB              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 186++CBBB              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 187++CBBB EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 188++CBBC DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 189++CBBE C5                                   push    bc
 190++CBBF DD E1                                pop     ix
 191++CBC1 C1                                   pop     bc
 192++CBC2 CD CF CB                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 193++CBC5 3A 83 CA                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 194++CBC8 3D                                   dec     a
 195++CBC9 32 83 CA                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 196++CBCC C3 C2 CA     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 197++CBCF              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 198++CBCF              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 199++CBCF 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 200++CBD0 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 201++CBD3 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 202++CBD5 32 61 7F     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 203++CBD8 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 204++CBDB CD 51 CC                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 205++CBDE                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 206++CBDE                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 207++CBDE C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 208++CBE1 2A 84 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 209++CBE4 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 210++CBE5 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 211++CBE7 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 212++CBEA 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 213++CBEC FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 214++CBEE 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 215++CBF0 3D                                   dec     a
 216++CBF1 32 61 7F                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 217++CBF4 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 218++CBF7 CD 51 CC                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 219++CBFA                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 220++CBFA                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 221++CBFA C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 222++CBFD 2A 84 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 223++CC00 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 224++CC01 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 225++CC03 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 226++CC06              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 227++CC06 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 228++CC07 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 229++CC0A 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 230++CC0C 32 61 7F                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 231++CC0F 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 232++CC10 32 60 7F                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 233++CC13 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 234++CC16 CD B2 CC                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 235++CC19                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 236++CC19                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 237++CC19 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 238++CC1C D5                                   push    de
 239++CC1D EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 240++CC1E 2A 84 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 241++CC21 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 242++CC22 D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 243++CC23 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 244++CC26 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 245++CC27 E6 80                                and     $80
 246++CC29 B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 247++CC2A C8                                   ret     z
 248++CC2B E5                                   push    hl
 249++CC2C 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 250++CC2E 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 251++CC31 B7                                   or      a
 252++CC32 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 253++CC34 22 60 7F                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 254++CC37 7C                                   ld      a,h
 255++CC38 E1                                   pop     hl
 256++CC39 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 257++CC3C C0                                   ret     nz
 258++CC3D              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 259++CC3D E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 260++CC40 CD B2 CC                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 261++CC43                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 262++CC43                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 263++CC43 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 264++CC46 D5                                   push    de
 265++CC47 EB                                   ex      hl,de
 266++CC48 2A 84 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 267++CC4B 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 268++CC4C 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 269++CC4F D1                                   pop     de
 270++CC50 C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 271++CC51                      ENDIF
 272++CC51
 273++CC51              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 274++CC51              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 275++CC51              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 276++CC51              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 277++CC51 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 278++CC52 32 60 7F                             ld      (varR),a
 279++CC55 CD 0F CD                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 280++CC58 F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 281++CC59 C5                                   push    bc
 282++CC5A 47                                   ld      b,a
 283++CC5B 3A 7B 7F                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 284++CC5E FE 00                                cp      0
 285++CC60 78                                   ld      a,b
 286++CC61 C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 287++CC62 C2 79 CC                             jp      nz, .LL121
 288++CC65              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 289++CC65 3A 7F CA     .LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 290++CC68 32 5F 7F                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 291++CC6B CD 7B 90                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 292++CC6E 22 84 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 293++CC71 F1                                   pop     af
 294++CC72 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 295++CC75 CA A5 CC                             jp      z,.LL133
 296++CC78 C9                                   ret
 297++CC79 11 FE FF     .LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 298++CC7C 2A 60 7F                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 299++CC7F 3A 5F 7F                             ld      a,(varQ)
 300++CC82 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 301++CC83              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 301++CC83 CB 25       >			   sla l
 301++CC85 CB 14       >			   rl  h
 302++CC87 7C                                   ld      a,h
 303++CC88 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 304++CC8A                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 304++CC8A B8          >                        cp      b
 304++CC8B DA 96 CC    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 305++CC8E 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 306++CC8F 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 307++CC90 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 308++CC91 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 309++CC92 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 310++CC94 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 311++CC95 3F                                   ccf
 312++CC96              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 312++CC96 CB 13       >               rl  e
 312++CC98 CB 12       >               rl  d
 313++CC9A 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 314++CC9C ED 53 84 CA                          ld      (varYX),de
 315++CCA0 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 316++CCA1 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 317++CCA4 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 318++CCA5 2A 84 CA     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 319++CCA8                                      NegHL
 319++CCA8 AF          >                    xor a
 319++CCA9 95          >                    sub l
 319++CCAA 6F          >                    ld l,a
 319++CCAB 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 319++CCAC 94          >                    sub h
 319++CCAD 67          >                    ld h,a
 320++CCAE 22 84 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 321++CCB1 C9           .LL128:                 ret
 322++CCB2
 323++CCB2
 324++CCB2
 325++CCB2
 326++CCB2              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 327++CCB2              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 328++CCB2              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 329++CCB2              ;
 330++CCB2              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 331++CCB2              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 332++CCB2              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 333++CCB2 CD 0F CD     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 334++CCB5 F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 335++CCB6 C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 336++CCB7 47                                   ld      b,a
 337++CCB8 3A 7B 7F                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 338++CCBB FE 00                                cp      0
 339++CCBD 78                                   ld      a,b
 340++CCBE C1                                   pop     bc
 341++CCBF C2 FB CC                             jp      nz, .LL122
 342++CCC2              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 343++CCC2 11 FE FF     .LL121:                 ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 344++CCC5 2A 60 7F                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 345++CCC8 3A 5F 7F                             ld      a,(varQ)
 346++CCCB 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 347++CCCC              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 347++CCCC CB 25       >			   sla l
 347++CCCE CB 14       >			   rl  h
 348++CCD0 7C                                   ld      a,h
 349++CCD1 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 350++CCD3                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 350++CCD3 B8          >                        cp      b
 350++CCD4 DA DF CC    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 351++CCD7 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 352++CCD8 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 353++CCD9 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 354++CCDA 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 355++CCDB DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 356++CCDD 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 357++CCDE 3F                                   ccf
 358++CCDF              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 358++CCDF CB 13       >               rl  e
 358++CCE1 CB 12       >               rl  d
 359++CCE3 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 360++CCE5 ED 53 84 CA                          ld      (varYX),de
 361++CCE9 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 362++CCEA ED 27 80                             test    $80
 363++CCED C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 364++CCEE 2A 84 CA     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 365++CCF1                                      NegHL
 365++CCF1 AF          >                    xor a
 365++CCF2 95          >                    sub l
 365++CCF3 6F          >                    ld l,a
 365++CCF4 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 365++CCF5 94          >                    sub h
 365++CCF6 67          >                    ld h,a
 366++CCF7 22 84 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 367++CCFA C9           .LL128:                 ret
 368++CCFB              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 369++CCFB 3A 7F CA     .LL122:                 ld      a,(clipGradient)
 370++CCFE 32 5F 7F                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 371++CD01 CD 7B 90                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 372++CD04 22 84 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 373++CD07 F1                                   pop     af
 374++CD08 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 375++CD0B CA EE CC                             jp      z,.LL133
 376++CD0E C9                                   ret
 377++CD0F
 378++CD0F              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 379++CD0F              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 380++CD0F              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 381++CD0F              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 382++CD0F 3A 7F CA     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 383++CD12 32 5F 7F                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = XX12+2
 384++CD15 3A 61 7F                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 385++CD18 E5 F5                                push    hl,,af                      ; else
 386++CD1A ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;   if bit 7 is clear
 387++CD1D 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127                    ;      RS = ABS RS
 388++CD1F 2A 60 7F                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ;      .
 389++CD22                                      NegHL                               ;      .
 389++CD22 AF          >                    xor a
 389++CD23 95          >                    sub l
 389++CD24 6F          >                    ld l,a
 389++CD25 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 389++CD26 94          >                    sub h
 389++CD27 67          >                    ld h,a
 390++CD28 22 60 7F                             ld      (varRS),hl                  ;      .
 391++CD2B 21 80 CA     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign              ;   hl = dxy sign
 392++CD2E F1                                   pop     af                          ;
 393++CD2F AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 394++CD30 E1                                   pop     hl
 395++CD31 C9                                   ret
 396++CD32
 397++CD32              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 398++CD32              ; Thow away out of bounds by more than 250
 399++CD32              ClipLineV3:             ;break
 400++CD32                      IFDEF       CLIPVersion3
 401++CD32 ~            ;My logic version
 402++CD32 ~            .CheckYorder:
 403++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipY1)
 404++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipY2)
 405++CD32 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn
 406++CD32 ~                                    jr      c,.LineP1toP2                          ; if Y1 < Y2 then we can use the points as is else we have to swap
 407++CD32 ~            .LineP2toP1:            ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; fetch and write out in reverse
 408++CD32 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY1)
 409++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 410++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 411++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY1),bc                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 412++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY2),ix                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 413++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX1),hl                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 414++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX2),de                      ;  de - XX15(4,5) X2
 415++CD32 ~                                    jp      .CheckNoClip
 416++CD32 ~            .LineP1toP2             ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 417++CD32 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 418++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 419++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5) X2
 420++CD32 ~            .CheckNoClip:           ld      a,b
 421++CD32 ~                                    or      d
 422++CD32 ~                                    or      h
 423++CD32 ~                                    or      ixh
 424++CD32 ~                                    jp      nz,.CheckXOffScreen                 ; if both Y1 and y2 have bit 7 set
 425++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,c                                 ; then we clip
 426++CD32 ~                                    and     ixl
 427++CD32 ~                                    test    $80
 428++CD32 ~                                    jp      z, .ClipComplete
 429++CD32 ~            ;if either x1hi x2hi are 0 then we clip. if both <> 0and both same sign exit
 430++CD32 ~            .CheckXOffScreen:       ld      a,h
 431++CD32 ~                                    xor     d
 432++CD32 ~                                    test    $80                                 ; non descructive test of bit 7 is set
 433++CD32 ~                                    jp      nz,.X1X2OppositeSign                ; if bit 7 was set then x1 and x2 must be opposite signs so its on screen
 434++CD32 ~            .X1X2SameSigns:         ld      a,h                                 ; so to get there h and d must be the same sign
 435++CD32 ~                                    test    $80                                 ; if they are the same sign and at x1 is negative then x2 must be negative so off screen
 436++CD32 ~                                    JumpIfAIsZero .X1X2CheckIfBothRight
 437++CD32 ~            .X1X2BothNegative:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 438++CD32 ~                                    ret
 439++CD32 ~            .X1X2CheckIfBothRight:  and     a                                   ; we have h in a already
 440++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.X1OnScreen
 441++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,d
 442++CD32 ~                                    and     a
 443++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.X2OnScreen
 444++CD32 ~            .X1X2OffRightSide:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 445++CD32 ~                                    ret
 446++CD32 ~            ;                       to get to here x1 and x2 either span -ve to +ve or from on screen to off screen
 447++CD32 ~            .X1OnScreen:
 448++CD32 ~            .X2OnScreen:
 449++CD32 ~            .X1X2OppositeSign:
 450++CD32 ~            ;                       Now check to see if Y is off screen
 451++CD32 ~            .CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                     ; Check if y1 and y2 are opposite signs, fi so it spans screen so we are good
 452++CD32 ~            .CheckBothYNegative:    xor     ixh
 453++CD32 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; if bit 7 is set then opposite signs
 454++CD32 ~                                    jp      nz,.Y1Y2OppositeSign                    ; if y1 and y2 are opposite signs its on screen and spans at least one side
 455++CD32 ~            .Y1Y2SameSign:          ld      a,b                                     ; if they are the same sign then if one is negative, so is the other so off screen
 456++CD32 ~                                    test    $80
 457++CD32 ~                                    jp      z,.Y1Y2Positive
 458++CD32 ~            .Y1Y2Negative:          SetCarryFlag
 459++CD32 ~                                    ret
 460++CD32 ~            .Y1Y2Positive:          ld      a,c                                     ; if its the same sign y1 or y2 could be 0 and if they are
 461++CD32 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; this will test to see if b >0 or c > 127
 462++CD32 ~                                    or      b                                       ;
 463++CD32 ~                                    jp      z,.Y1OnScreen
 464++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 465++CD32 ~                                    and     $80
 466++CD32 ~                                    or      ixh
 467++CD32 ~                                    jp      z,.Y2OnScreen
 468++CD32 ~            .Y1Y2OffBottomSide:     SetCarryFlag
 469++CD32 ~                                    ret
 470++CD32 ~            .Y1OnScreen:
 471++CD32 ~            .Y2OnScreen:
 472++CD32 ~            .Y1Y2OppositeSign:
 473++CD32 ~            .StartProcessing:       ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)                      ; Now we can test and Clip
 474++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5)
 475++CD32 ~                                    ld      iyh,0                                   ; set iyh flags to 0
 476++CD32 ~            ; if x1hi or y1 high <> 0 or y1 > 127 then set bit 1 of clipcoord       ; we can optimise this later
 477++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,h
 478++CD32 ~                                    or      b
 479++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP1Ylo
 480++CD32 ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 481++CD32 ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 482++CD32 ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 483++CD32 ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 484++CD32 ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 485++CD32 ~            .P1OffScreen:           ld      iyh,1                                   ; if either p1 x or y was off screen set bit 0 to 1
 486++CD32 ~                                    jp      .CheckP2OffScreen                       ; .
 487++CD32 ~            .CheckP1Ylo:            ld      a,c                                     ; .
 488++CD32 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 489++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2OffScreen                     ; .
 490++CD32 ~                                    ld      iyh,1                                   ; .
 491++CD32 ~            .CheckP2OffScreen:      ld      a,d                                     ; if x2hi or y2 off screen then set bit 2 of clipcoord to 1
 492++CD32 ~                                    or      ixh                                     ; .
 493++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2Ylo                           ; .
 494++CD32 ~            .P2OffScreen:           ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 495++CD32 ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 496++CD32 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 497++CD32 ~                                    jp      .CheckXDirection                        ; .
 498++CD32 ~            .CheckP2Ylo:            ld      a,ixl                                   ; .
 499++CD32 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 500++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckXDirection                      ; .
 501++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 502++CD32 ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 503++CD32 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 504++CD32 ~            .CheckXDirection:       push    de,,hl
 505++CD32 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn                          ; IF HL equals DE, Z=1,C=0, IF HL is less than DE, Z=0,C=1, IF HL is more than DE, Z=0,C=0
 506++CD32 ~                                    pop     de,,hl
 507++CD32 ~                                    jp      c,.CalculateDx                          ;
 508++CD32 ~            .X1gteX2:               ld      a,iyh                                   ; if x1 >= x2 then set bit 3 to denote -ve x direction, note we will eliminate horziontal / vertical early as an optimisation
 509++CD32 ~                                    or      4                                       ; .
 510++CD32 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 511++CD32 ~                                    ; Y Direction is now always top to bottom
 512++CD32 ~            .CalculateDx:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ;                       calculate DX
 513++CD32 ~                                    sbc     hl,de                                   ; .
 514++CD32 ~            .ABSDX:                 ld      a,h                                     ; HL = | HL - DE |
 515++CD32 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 516++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.DXPositive                           ; .
 517++CD32 ~                                    macronegate16hl                                 ; .
 518++CD32 ~            .DXPositive:            ex      de,hl                                   ; de = abs delta x
 519++CD32 ~            .CalculateDy:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ; hl = Y2 -Y1 as its pre sorted its always positive if on screen
 520++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,ix                                   ; iy = hl = Y2 - Y1
 521++CD32 ~                                    sbc     hl,bc                                   ; .
 522++CD32 ~            .DYPositive:            ; Scale DX and DY to 8 bit, by here hl = abs dy, de = abs dx
 523++CD32 ~            ;calculate DY
 524++CD32 ~            .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                                     ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 525++CD32 ~                                    or      d                                       ; .
 526++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.ScaleDone                            ; .
 527++CD32 ~                                    ShiftDERight1                                   ; .
 528++CD32 ~                                    ShiftHLRight1                                   ; .
 529++CD32 ~                                    jr      .ScaleLoop                              ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been;;                                                                                               negative
 530++CD32 ~            .ScaleDone:             ; hl = ABS DY, DE = ABS DX,  bc = Y1, ix = Y2,   note H and D will be zero
 531++CD32 ~            ; if Dx = 0 then horizontal line and clip X1 & X2 only then exit
 532++CD32 ~            ; if Dy = 0 then vertical line and clip Y1 & Y2 only then exit
 533++CD32 ~
 534++CD32 ~            ; if DX < DY  gradient = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 535++CD32 ~            ;        else gradient = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo, set bit 5 of clipcord
 536++CD32 ~            .CalculateDelta:        ld      a,e                                     ; if DX < DY goto DX/DY
 537++CD32 ~                                    JumpIfALTNusng l,.DXdivDY                       ; else do DY/DX
 538++CD32 ~            .DYdivDX:               ld      a,l                                     ;    A = DY
 539++CD32 ~                                    ld      d,e                                     ;    D = DX
 540++CD32 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DY / DX
 541++CD32 ~            .SaveGradientDYDX:      ld      (Gradient),a
 542++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ;    bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DX/DY (steep), if its clear its DY/DX (shallow)
 543++CD32 ~                                    or      16                                      ;    .
 544++CD32 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ;    .
 545++CD32 ~                                    jp      .ClipP1                                 ;    .
 546++CD32 ~            .DXdivDY:               ld      a,e                                     ;    A = DX
 547++CD32 ~                                    ld      d,l                                     ;    D = DY
 548++CD32 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DX / DY
 549++CD32 ~            .SaveGradientDXDY:      ld      (Gradient),a
 550++CD32 ~            ; if bit 1 of clipccord is set call    LL118
 551++CD32 ~            .ClipP1:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; if bit 1 is clear to say no need to clip pont 1 we just jump to point 2
 552++CD32 ~                                    test    1                                       ; .
 553++CD32 ~                                    jp      z,.ClipP2                               ; .
 554++CD32 ~                                    call    LL118v3                                 ; else clip P1 first
 555++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ;      and if b or h have a value its failed to totally clip  as it may be only in bounds on just x or y
 556++CD32 ~                                    or      h                                       ;      .
 557++CD32 ~                                    jr      z, .P1Ygt127Check                       ;      .
 558++CD32 ~            .P1HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 559++CD32 ~                                    ret                                             ;      .
 560++CD32 ~            .P1Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ;      or if y > 127 its failed to totally clip
 561++CD32 ~                                    test    $80                                     ;      .
 562++CD32 ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 563++CD32 ~                                    ret     nz                                      ;      .
 564++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY1), bc                     ;      else its valid and clipped point 1 so save ti back
 565++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX1), hl
 566++CD32 ~            ; if bit 2 of clipcoord is set
 567++CD32 ~            ;        swap x1y1 with x2y2
 568++CD32 ~            ;        call    LL118
 569++CD32 ~            .ClipP2:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; so now repeat all that for point 2
 570++CD32 ~                                    and     2
 571++CD32 ~                                    jp      z,.ClipComplete
 572++CD32 ~                                    call    LL118v3PreSwap                          ; now clip p2
 573++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ; if either high is set then it failed to properly clip
 574++CD32 ~                                    or      h                                       ; .
 575++CD32 ~                                    jr      z, .P2Ygt127Check                       ; .
 576++CD32 ~            .P2HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 577++CD32 ~                                    ret                                             ; .
 578++CD32 ~            .P2Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ; if c > 127 then it also failed to clip
 579++CD32 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 580++CD32 ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 581++CD32 ~                                    ret     nz                                      ; .
 582++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY2), bc                     ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 583++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX2), hl
 584++CD32 ~            ;clip compelte exit
 585++CD32 ~            .ClipComplete:          ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 586++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 587++CD32 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 588++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 589++CD32 ~            .SaveClippedLine:       ld      a,c                                     ; Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
 590++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
 591++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 592++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
 593++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,l
 594++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
 595++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,e
 596++CD32 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
 597++CD32 ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                              ; we have a success so not carry
 598++CD32 ~                                    ret
 599++CD32 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 600++CD32 ~            LL118v3PreSwap:         ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY2)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 601++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 602++CD32 ~                                    jp      LL118v3Fetched
 603++CD32 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 604++CD32 ~            LL118v3:                ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 605++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 606++CD32 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 607++CD32 ~            LL118v3Fetched:
 608++CD32 ~            ;                       At this point bc = y position, hl = x position both 16 bit
 609++CD32 ~            ;                       if x < 0 then x = 0
 610++CD32 ~            ;                                     adjust = -x */ gradient depending on if its steep or shallow
 611++CD32 ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 612++CD32 ~            ;                       if x > 255 then x = 255
 613++CD32 ~            ;                                     adjust = x-255 */ gradient
 614++CD32 ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 615++CD32 ~            ;                       if y < 0 then y = 0
 616++CD32 ~            ;                                     adjust = -y */ gradient
 617++CD32 ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 618++CD32 ~            ;                       if y >127 then y = 127
 619++CD32 ~            ;                                     adjust = y-127 */ gradient
 620++CD32 ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 621++CD32 ~            ;
 622++CD32 ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 623++CD32 ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 624++CD32 ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 625++CD32 ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 626++CD32 ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 627++CD32 ~            ; if X1 hi <> 0
 628++CD32 ~            LL118:                  ;break
 629++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,h                                     ; if x1 high is 0 then we don't need to clip x at all
 630++CD32 ~                                    and     a
 631++CD32 ~                                    jp      z,.X1NoClipNeeded
 632++CD32 ~            ;                       if x1 hi bit 7 is set (so negative)
 633++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockX:            test    $80                                     ; if h is postiive then jump to the XPositive Calc block
 634++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockXPositive
 635++CD32 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = abs(X1) / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 636++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockXNegative:    ld      a,iyh                                   ;
 637++CD32 ~                                    test    16                                      ; bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DY/DX, if its clear its DX/DY
 638++CD32 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXNegMulGrad
 639++CD32 ~            .CaclBlockXNegDivGrad:  macronegate16hl
 640++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 641++CD32 ~                                    push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) / Gradient
 642++CD32 ~                                    ld      h,c                     ; move offset into high byte of h
 643++CD32 ~                                    ld      l,0
 644++CD32 ~                                    ld      c,a
 645++CD32 ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 646++CD32 ~                                    pop     bc
 647++CD32 ~                                    jp      .DoneXNegCalc
 648++CD32 ~            ;                       else set Adjust = abs(X1) * Gradient
 649++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockXNegMulGrad:  push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) * Gradient
 650++CD32 ~                                    macronegate16hl
 651++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 652++CD32 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256
 653++CD32 ~                                    pop     bc
 654++CD32 ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 655++CD32 ~            ;                       x1 = 0 then call into DonrX1Calc
 656++CD32 ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 657++CD32 ~            .DoneXNegCalc:          macronegate16hl
 658++CD32 ~            .XNegSkipNegate:        ld      de,bc
 659++CD32 ~                                    ex      hl,de
 660++CD32 ~                                    add     hl,de
 661++CD32 ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 662++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,0
 663++CD32 ~                                    jp      .DoneXCalc
 664++CD32 ~            ;                       else x1 hi is positive
 665++CD32 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = X1 lo / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 666++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockXPositive:    ld      a,iyh
 667++CD32 ~                                    test    16
 668++CD32 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXPosMulGrad
 669++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockXPosDivGrad:  ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 670++CD32 ~                                    push    bc
 671++CD32 ~                                    ld      c,a
 672++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,255
 673++CD32 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 674++CD32 ~                                    ld      h,l
 675++CD32 ~                                    ld      l,0
 676++CD32 ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 677++CD32 ~                                    pop     bc
 678++CD32 ~                                    jp      .DoneX2Calc
 679++CD32 ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = X1 lo * Gradient
 680++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockXPosMulGrad:  push    bc
 681++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 682++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,255
 683++CD32 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 684++CD32 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 685++CD32 ~                                    pop     bc
 686++CD32 ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 687++CD32 ~            ;                       x1 = 255
 688++CD32 ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 689++CD32 ~            .DoneX2Calc:            macronegate16hl
 690++CD32 ~            .X2SkipNegate:          ex      de,hl
 691++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 692++CD32 ~                                    add     hl,de
 693++CD32 ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 694++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,255
 695++CD32 ~            ;                       if Y1 hi <> 0 or Y1 low >= 128 then y coordinate is good
 696++CD32 ~            .DoneXCalc:             ld      a,b
 697++CD32 ~                                    and     a
 698++CD32 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockY1Test
 699++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,c
 700++CD32 ~                                    and     $80
 701++CD32 ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                  ; speculative clear of carry in case its good
 702++CD32 ~                                    ret     z
 703++CD32 ~            ;                       if Y1 hi bit 7 is set
 704++CD32 ~            .X1NoClipNeeded:
 705++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockY1Test:       ld      a,b
 706++CD32 ~                                    test    $80
 707++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockYPos       ; if Y is positive jump forward
 708++CD32 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = abs(Y1) / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 709++CD32 ~                                    break
 710++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockY1:           ld      a,iyh
 711++CD32 ~                                    test    16
 712++CD32 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockYNegMulGrad
 713++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockYNegDivGrad:  macronegate16bc
 714++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 715++CD32 ~                                    push    hl
 716++CD32 ~                                    ld      h,c                     ; move offset into high byte of h
 717++CD32 ~                                    ld      l,0
 718++CD32 ~                                    ld      c,a
 719++CD32 ~                                    call    div_hl_c;LLHLdivC;div_hl_c
 720++CD32 ~                                    pop     de
 721++CD32 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 722++CD32 ~                                    jp      .DoneBlockY1
 723++CD32 ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = abs(Y1) * Gradient
 724++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockYNegMulGrad:  macronegate16bc
 725++CD32 ~                                    push    hl
 726++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 727++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 728++CD32 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 729++CD32 ~                                    pop     de
 730++CD32 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 731++CD32 ~            ;                       x1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 3 of clipcoord is set)
 732++CD32 ~            ;                       y1 = 0
 733++CD32 ~            ;                       ret
 734++CD32 ~            ;                       now we have done the adjustment, if y or x are off screen then the line spans screen in only 1 dimension so doesn't get drawn
 735++CD32 ~            .DoneBlockY1:           ld      a,iyh
 736++CD32 ~                                    test    4
 737++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.Y1SkipNegate
 738++CD32 ~                                    macronegate16de
 739++CD32 ~            .Y1SkipNegate:          add     hl,de
 740++CD32 ~                                    ld      bc,0
 741++CD32 ~                                    ret
 742++CD32 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = Y1 lo / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 743++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockYPos:         ld      a,iyh
 744++CD32 ~                                    test    16
 745++CD32 ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockYPosMulGrad
 746++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockYPosDivGrad:  ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 747++CD32 ~                                    push    hl
 748++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 749++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,127
 750++CD32 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 751++CD32 ~                                    ld      h,l
 752++CD32 ~                                    ld      l,0
 753++CD32 ~                                    ld      c,a
 754++CD32 ~                                    call    div_hl_c;LLHLdivC
 755++CD32 ~                                    pop     de
 756++CD32 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 757++CD32 ~                                    jp      .DoneBlockY2
 758++CD32 ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = Y1 lo * Gradient
 759++CD32 ~            .CalcBlockYPosMulGrad:  push    hl
 760++CD32 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 761++CD32 ~                                    ld      de,127
 762++CD32 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 763++CD32 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 764++CD32 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 765++CD32 ~                                    pop     de
 766++CD32 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 767++CD32 ~            ;                x1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 3 of clipcoord is set)
 768++CD32 ~            ;                y1 = 127
 769++CD32 ~            .DoneBlockY2:           ld      a,iyh
 770++CD32 ~                                    test    4
 771++CD32 ~                                    jr      nz,.Y2SkipNegate
 772++CD32 ~                                    macronegate16de
 773++CD32 ~            .Y2SkipNegate:          add     hl,de
 774++CD32 ~                                    ld      bc,127
 775++CD32 ~                                    ret
 776++CD32                      ELSE
 777++CD32 C9                       ret
 778++CD33                      ENDIF
 779++CD33              ; old code for on screen test
 780++CD33              ;;;;;;; if y1 > 127 and y2 > 127 then same sing and exit
 781++CD33              ;;;;;;

 783++CD33              ;;;;;;.CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                 ; y1 and y2 high tests

 785++CD33              ;;;;;;                        jp      .CheckYLow

 796++CD33              ;;;;;;                        ret     z                                   ;

 815++CD33              ;;;;;;                        cp      0                                   ;

 817++CD33              ;;;;;;.CheckYSameSign:        ld      a,b                                 ; if we get here Y1 high and Y2 high are not zero
 818++CD33              ;;;;;;                        xor     ixh                                 ; so same sign then bail out if they are

 781+ CD33                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm
   1++CD33              ; Set TransMatTo
   2++CD33              ; XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)   = sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z XX16(13,12) (15 14) (17 16)
   3++CD33              ; XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10) = roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10)
   4++CD33              ; XX16(13 12) (15 14) (17 16) = nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)
   5++CD33              ; This moves Side XYZ to position 0, Roof XYZ to position 1 annd nose XYZ to position 2 as a copy of each batch of 6 bytes
   6++CD33              ; 18 byte fast copy
   7++CD33
   8++CD33              ; Fast copy using the stack                                                         ; T states
   9++CD33 F3           CopyRotmatToTransMat:   di                                                          ; disable interrups to protect during copy
  10++CD34 DD 21 00 00                          ld      ix,0                                                ; 14
  11++CD38 DD 39                                add     ix,sp                                               ; 15
  12++CD3A 31 2A C0                             ld      sp,UBnkrotmatSidevX ; Source                        ; 10
  13++CD3D E1                                   pop     hl                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevX              ; 10
  14++CD3E D1                                   pop     de                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevY              ; 10
  15++CD3F C1                                   pop     bc                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevZ              ; 10
  16++CD40 D9                                   exx                                                         ; 4
  17++CD41 E1                                   pop     hl                  ; UBnkrotmatRoofvX              ; 10
  18++CD42 D1                                   pop     de                  ; UBnkrotmatRoofvY              ; 10
  19++CD43 C1                                   pop     bc                  ; UBnkrotmatRoofvZ              ; 10
  20++CD44 31 6E C0                             ld      sp,UBnkTransmatRoofvZ+2 ; Target + 2 reversed       ; 10
  21++CD47 C5                                   push    bc                                                  ; 10
  22++CD48 D5                                   push    de                                                  ; 10
  23++CD49 E5                                   push    hl                                                  ; 10
  24++CD4A D9                                   exx                                                         ; 4
  25++CD4B C5                                   push    bc                                                  ; 10
  26++CD4C D5                                   push    de                                                  ; 10
  27++CD4D E5                                   push    hl                                                  ; 10
  28++CD4E 31 36 C0                             ld      sp,UBnkrotmatNosevX ; Source                        ; 10
  29++CD51 E1                                   pop     hl                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevX              ; 10
  30++CD52 D1                                   pop     de                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevY              ; 10
  31++CD53 C1                                   pop     bc                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevZ              ; 10
  32++CD54 31 74 C0                             ld      sp,UBnkTransmatNosevZ+2                             ; 10
  33++CD57 C5                                   push    bc                                                  ; 10
  34++CD58 D5                                   push    de                                                  ; 10
  35++CD59 E5                                   push    hl                                                  ; 10
  36++CD5A DD F9                                ld      sp,ix               ; restore stack                 ; 10
  37++CD5C                                  IFNDEF INTERRUPS_DISABLE
  38++CD5C FB                                   ei
  39++CD5D                                  ENDIF
  40++CD5D C9                                   ret                                                         ; 10 Total 267 (LDI version is 318)
  41++CD5E
  42++CD5E
  43++CD5E
  44++CD5E              ;CopyRotmatToTransMat:
  45++CD5E              ;                        ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
  46++CD5E              ;                        ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  47++CD5E              ;                        SixLDIInstrunctions
  48++CD5E              ;                        ld      hl,UBnkrotmatRoofvX
  49++CD5E              ;                        ld      de, UBnkTransmatRoofvX
  50++CD5E              ;                        SixLDIInstrunctions
  51++CD5E              ;                        ld      hl,UBnkrotmatNosevX
  52++CD5E              ;                        ld      de, UBnkTransmatNosevX
  53++CD5E              ;                        SixLDIInstrunctions
  54++CD5E              ;                        ret
  55++CD5E
  56++CD5E              CopyRotToTransMacro:    MACRO
  57++CD5E ~                                    ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
  58++CD5E ~                                    ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  59++CD5E ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  60++CD5E ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  61++CD5E ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions
  62++CD5E                                      ENDM

 782+ CD5E                                      include "./Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
   1++CD5E              TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15:
   2++CD5E 2A AD C0             ld		hl,(UBnkXX12xLo)					; get X into HL
   3++CD61 7C           		ld		a,h			                        ; get XX12 Sign
   4++CD62 E6 80        		and		$80									; check sign bit on high byte
   5++CD64 47           		ld		b,a									; and put it in of 12xlo in b
   6++CD65                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
   7++CD65 7C                   ld      a,h
   8++CD66 E6 7F                and     $7F
   9++CD68 67                   ld      h,a
  10++CD69                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  11++CD69 ED 5B 20 C0  		ld		de,(UBnKxlo)						;
  12++CD6D 3A 22 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKxsgn)						; get Ship Pos (low,high,sign)
  13++CD70 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  14++CD72 4F           		ld		c,a									; and put sign of unkxsgn c
  15++CD73 CD 33 00     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC		; this will result in HL = result and A = sign
  16++CD76 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H to give 15 bit signed (*NOT* 2's c)
  17++CD77 67           		ld		h,a
  18++CD78 22 A7 C0     		ld		(UBnkXScaled),hl					; now write it out to XX15 X pos
  19++CD7B              ; ..................................
  20++CD7B 2A AF C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12yLo)					; Repeat above for Y coordinate
  21++CD7E 7C           		ld		a,h
  22++CD7F E6 80        		and		$80
  23++CD81 47           		ld		b,a
  24++CD82                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  25++CD82 7C                   ld      a,h
  26++CD83 E6 7F                and     $7F
  27++CD85 67                   ld      h,a
  28++CD86                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  29++CD86 ED 5B 23 C0  		ld		de,(UBnKylo)
  30++CD8A 3A 25 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKysgn)
  31++CD8D E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  32++CD8F 4F           		ld		c,a
  33++CD90 CD 33 00     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  34++CD93 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  35++CD94 67           		ld		h,a
  36++CD95 22 A9 C0     		ld		(UBnkYScaled),hl
  37++CD98              ; ..................................
  38++CD98 2A B1 C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12zLo)					; and now repeat for Z cooord
  39++CD9B 7C           		ld		a,h
  40++CD9C E6 80        		and		$80
  41++CD9E 47           		ld		b,a
  42++CD9F                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  43++CD9F 7C                   ld      a,h
  44++CDA0 E6 7F                and     $7F
  45++CDA2 67                   ld      h,a
  46++CDA3                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  47++CDA3 ED 5B 26 C0  		ld		de,(UBnKzlo)
  48++CDA7 3A 28 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKzsgn)
  49++CDAA E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  50++CDAC 4F           		ld		c,a
  51++CDAD CD 33 00     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  52++CDB0 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  53++CDB1 67           		ld		h,a
  54++CDB2 CB 7C        		bit		7,h                                 ; if sign if positive then we don't need to do the clamp so we ony jump
  55++CDB4 20 16        		jr		nz,ClampZto4                        ; result was negative so we need to clamp to 4
  56++CDB6 E6 7F                and     $7F                                 ; a = value unsigned
  57++CDB8 20 06                jr      nz,NoClampZto4                      ; if high byte was 0 then we could need to clamp still by this stage its +v but and will set z flag if high byte is zero
  58++CDBA 7D                   ld      a,l                                 ; get low byte now
  59++CDBB              		JumpIfALTNusng 4,ClampZto4					; if its < 4 then fix at 4
  59++CDBB FE 04       >                        cp      4
  59++CDBD DA CC CD    >                        jp		c, ClampZto4
  60++CDC0              NoClampZto4:
  61++CDC0 22 AB C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl					; hl = signed calculation and > 4
  62++CDC3 7D           		ld		a,l									; in addition write out the z cooord to UT for now for backwards compat (DEBUG TODO remove later)
  63++CDC4 32 7B 7F             ld      (varT),a
  64++CDC7 7C           		ld		a,h
  65++CDC8 32 5E 7F             ld      (varU),a
  66++CDCB C9           		ret
  67++CDCC              ClampZto4:											; This is where we limit 4 to a minimum of 4
  68++CDCC 21 04 00     		ld		hl,4
  69++CDCF 22 AB C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl; BODGE FOR NOW
  70++CDD2 7D           		ld		a,l
  71++CDD3 32 7B 7F             ld      (varT),a                            ;                                                                           ;;;
  72++CDD6 7C           		ld		a,h
  73++CDD7 32 5E 7F             ld      (varU),a 						; compatibility for now
  74++CDDA C9           		ret
  75++CDDB
# file closed: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
 783+ CDDB                                      include "./Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm"
# file opened: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm
   1++CDDB              ScaleNodeTo8Bit:								; TODO make signed
   2++CDDB ED 4B AB C0  	ld			bc,(UBnkZScaled)
   3++CDDF 2A A7 C0     	ld			hl,(UBnkXScaled)
   4++CDE2 ED 5B A9 C0  	ld			de,(UBnkYScaled)
   5++CDE6              SetABSbc:
   6++CDE6 78           	ld			a,b
   7++CDE7 DD 67        	ld			ixh,a
   8++CDE9 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
   9++CDEB 47           	ld			b,a									; bc = ABS bc
  10++CDEC              SetABShl:
  11++CDEC 7C           	ld			a,h
  12++CDED DD 6F        	ld			ixl,a
  13++CDEF E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  14++CDF1 67           	ld			h,a									; hl = ABS hl
  15++CDF2              SetABSde:
  16++CDF2 7A           	ld			a,d
  17++CDF3 FD 67        	ld			iyh,a
  18++CDF5 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  19++CDF7 57           	ld			d,a									; de = ABS de
  20++CDF8              ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop:
  21++CDF8 78               ld          a,b		                            ; U	\ z hi
  22++CDF9 B4           	or			h                                   ; XX15+1	\ x hi
  23++CDFA B2           	or			d                                   ; XX15+4	\ y hi
  24++CDFB 28 0F            jr          z,ScaleNodeDone                   ; if X, Y, Z = 0  exit loop down once hi U rolled to 0
  25++CDFD                  ShiftHLRight1
  25++CDFD CB 3C       >			   srl h
  25++CDFF CB 1D       >			   rr  l
  26++CE01                  ShiftDERight1
  26++CE01 CB 3A       >			   srl d
  26++CE03 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
  27++CE05              	ShiftBCRight1
  27++CE05 CB 38       >			   srl b
  27++CE07 CB 19       >			   rr  c
  28++CE09 C3 F8 CD         jp          ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop
  29++CE0C              ScaleNodeDone:										; now we have scaled values we have to deal with sign
  30++CE0C DD 7C        	ld			a,ixh								; get sign bit and or with b
  31++CE0E E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  32++CE10 B0           	or			b
  33++CE11 47           	ld			b,a
  34++CE12              SignforHL:
  35++CE12 DD 7D        	ld			a,ixl								; get sign bit and or with b
  36++CE14 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  37++CE16 B4           	or			h
  38++CE17 67           	ld			h,a
  39++CE18              SignforDE:
  40++CE18 FD 7C        	ld			a,iyh								; get sign bit and or with b
  41++CE1A E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  42++CE1C B2           	or			d
  43++CE1D 57           	ld			d,a
  44++CE1E              SignsDoneSaveResult:
  45++CE1E ED 43 AB C0  	ld			(UBnkZScaled),bc
  46++CE22 22 A7 C0     	ld			(UBnkXScaled),hl
  47++CE25 ED 53 A9 C0  	ld			(UBnkYScaled),de
  48++CE29 78           	ld			a,b
  49++CE2A 32 5E 7F     	ld			(varU),a
  50++CE2D 79           	ld			a,c
  51++CE2E 32 7B 7F     	ld			(varT),a
  52++CE31 C9           	ret
  53++CE32
# file closed: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm

 811+ CE58 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;

 821+ CE69              ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 822+ CE69              TidyRotation:       IFNDEF FORCE_TIDY
 823+ CE69 3A 29 C0                             ld      a,(UBnkTidyCounter)         ; loops every 16 iterations
 824+ CE6C 3D                                   dec     a                           ; and call is determined
 825+ CE6D E6 0F                                and     %00001111                   ; by if the counter
 826+ CE6F 32 29 C0                             ld      (UBnkTidyCounter),a         ; matches teh slot number
 827+ CE72 21 40 C0                             ld      hl,UBnKSlotNumber           ; of course this is then 16 slots max
 828+ CE75 BE                                   cp      (hl)
 829+ CE76 C0                                   ret     nz                          ; when counter matches slot number tidy stops it doing all tidies on same iteration
 830+ CE77                                  ENDIF
